description: I really enjoyed my burrito. Pollo asadA. Bomb. Lady was nice and gave me a free bag of chips with pico de gallo had napkins in the bag. Thank you for your service
author: Craig L.

description:
I agree with the other unfavorable reviews, especially the one saying how the woman there is trying to put them out of business. I was pretty hungry after work after not eating all day -- so I decided, why not? They aren't the best, but it's some food... That's was big mistake. 

I ordered the shrimp burrito with black beans. I learned that because of the woman's attitude, that if I add a tip to my credit card charge, I might get a little better service. This time... she and the cook talked about me in front of me, assuming I couldn't understand what they were saying. What happened was when my burrito came up... they had a little back and forth about how I had wanted black beans, but the cook at used pinto instead. It was determined that he didn't make it right -- but they agreed to give it to me instead, since it was "to go". She turned around and said, "yeah it's yours". I didn't believe her but hesitantly took it, thinking, well I can handle eating pinto beans even if she lied to me. 

Turns out the burrito was as disgusting as it gets. It had some sort of sloppy mayo sauce mixed with shredded iceberg -- and no beans at all. It was a soupy mess. Also the first bite I took had a shrimp skin and it felt like I had chewed on someone's gnasty finger nail! 

I actually drove back with my burrito and gave it back to them. She barely looked at me, took it and went over to the cook, and they snickered. She said to me, we're making you a new one. I said I didn't want it and wanted my money back. She gave it back, but tried to keep the tip. But she gave it back when I asked for it. Now I feel sick and have lost my appetite completely. I don't know why they are still in business, especially with all of the burrito places in SF! These people are rude and the burritos suck. I only eat there out of desperation. But from now on, I think I would rather starve to death.
author: C L.

description:
The woman working the register must be attempting to put the business out of business. Maybe an ex who did her wrong owns the place.  Maybe she owes taxes and is sticking it to the IRS by keeping customers not coming back? 
Well she mission accomplished me today.  Food was pretty good. I was hungry and they were there. But wow was she a breath of fetid air.
Read the reviews after I ate here and was not surprised she got some dishonorable mentions by several former customers.
Sandwich shop next door has great coffee, should have stayed there for lunch.
author: Miss F.

description:
I've been eating here for about 8 years and I'm sad to say it's gone very much downhill. After more than a few low quality meals, and a price increase, I can't give it another chance. 

Even though it's the closest taquera to my house I won't be able to eat such poor Mexican food again.
author: Chase B.

description: Pretty cool little spot by Ocean Beach. A little on the pricey side but worth it! There are a few spots to sit and eat, so dining in is definitely possible. I came on a Saturday afternoon, after a walk on the beach, and this place hit the spot! Check them out, if you're in the area.
author: Alexus S.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE! I'll preface this bu saying i dont ever leave yelp reviews... but my experience here was THAT bad and the food was even worse. And honestly Its my mistake for not reading their reviews before i stopped here to pick up some food. I drive by everyday bc its down the block from my kids preschool so i gave it a shot one day after picking him up. 

First, everyone is spot on about the "frumpy" lady up front. I took a few minutes to order with my 3 yr old and she stood there sighing at me and looking irritated. Keep in mind that it was about 5pm and there was NOBODY else waiting. So finally i order a steak, burrito, fish taco, and quesadilla. 

When my food is done, she doesnt offer me complimentary chips. I have to ask for it. Then when i get home i realized she didnt give us the side of beans with the quesadilla.   Not a big deal but its the principle. 

The food itself was TERRIBLE!  I took two bites of the carne asada burrito and threw the rest out. It wasnt fresh and the beef was bland & chewy. I never waste food but this sh*t was gross.  The fish taco was just as bad. It was super wet and the sauce they used wasnt anything special. At the very least, they got the cheese quesadilla right. A
author: Vince L.

description: California burrito with fries. on smack, it's hells lit. Get it or you ain't livin. And you can order food online before arriving.
author: Jray M.

description: The food is decent nothing extraordinary but the reason for the one star is because the woman who works the counter is the meanest and rudest person you could ever meet!
author: Kary M.

description: Food is berable but not great by any standards. Meat is flavorless. But heres the worst part. The cashier is a complete rude ass who seems to hate life. I asked for street tacos and she goes "whats that . Ive never heard of that. We dont have that here" like wtf? Youre a taqueria. As soon as i walk in she gives me a face like "o great". I thought it was me but then she does it to the next customers behind me. HEY RUDE ASS if you are reading this , learn some god damn manners
author: Eddie C.

description: Do not eat here! The woman behind the counter, with glasses, sat and argued with her worker for 10 minutes. While I was waiting a delivery driver came in, I guess she gave wrong order to him. She actually cussed him out! Threw away his order and yelled at him. He asked nicely about the order tag was wrong. She said it was his fault, then denied to give green sauce and napkins. How unbelievably rude she was.
author: Angela C.

description:
BUENO:  Big burrito.  An excellent creamy green sauce.  No refills, but the sodas are 16 ounce.  You can choose the type of tortilla, beans, and salsa.

NO BUENO:  
Besides being small with only one outside table, the carnitas were authentic, meaning I had to spit out three or four pieces of fat.  I'm not fat shaming- I just don't like eating it.
author: Glen N.

description: Im sorry, this use to be a pretty decent place to grab a burrito in the neighborhood, I dont know what happened or what changed, but I could not believe how bad its gotten. I ordered a Surfing Wet burrito and it was GIGANTIC, which is never a problem, but it was hands down the worst burrito I've ever attempted to eat. Not only was it drowning in sauce (again not normally bad) but the sauce tasted way off, literally tasted closer to a pasta sauce than a red sauce. The meat was beyond salty, over seasoned, overcooked, really the works. And filled, I mean filled, with jalapeños.
author: Jessica G.

description: Worst taqueria in the city. They should be ashamed. Why open a restaurant if you're unable to figure out which food goes where. I've had multiple instances where I've gotten someone else's order and vice versa. Zero organization. Oh, and if you call, they never pick up AND their mailbox is full.
author: Bev S.

description:
I'm very prone to suggestion. When I realized it was National Taco Day (Tuesday, October 4th, 2016), I decided I wanted tacos for dinner. The usual spots on the way home seemed boring, so the roommate and I decided to get delivery via Postmates. (They were doing a special for taco day, so the delivery fee was only $1.99.) I placed the order at 6:21pm and it arrived at 6:54pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Burrito Super ($9.30): Served with your choice of meat, rice, tortillas, beans, salsa - Refried beans, Carnitas, Hot salsa, Flour whole wheat tortilla (+$0.35), Guacamole (+$0.95), Jalapeno (+$0.75)
*Carnitas Taco ($2.75): Served with cilantro, onions and fresh salsa
*Fish Taco ($2.95): Served with baja style with cabbage, gaucamole and pancho sauce
*Shrimp Taco ($2.95): Served with cilantro, onions and fresh salsa
*Pollo Taco ($2.75): Served with cilantro, onions and fresh salsa
*Nachos Regular ($6): Served with melted cheese, Refried beans (on side), Hot salsa, Beef (+$1.50), Cheese (+$0.75), Guacamole (+$0.95), Jalapeno (+$0.75)
*Chicken Enchilada ($8.25)

I got the four tacos and the nachos. The tacos were a good size. I actually couldn't eat all of them since my eyes were hungrier than my stomach. I ate the shrimp and fish taco that day and had the other two for lunch the next. (Though I did take a bite of each that day for taste purposes.) The fish taco was good. Crispy and I love the cabbage and sauce that came with it. Provided a nice fresh crunchy contrast. The shrimp tacos were okay. It had a good amount of shrimp, but I found them to be a little rubbery. The carnitas taco was good even with reheating. Nice, crispy, fried pork pieces. The chicken one was just all right. I found the chicken a little dry.

I really enjoyed the nachos, but I wanted them to be cheesier. I paid for extra cheese, but I not sure if I got it. If so, then the dish doesn't normally come with much cheese. I did enjoy all the toppings though. The beef had a nice smokey grill flavor. The dish itself had a nice heat from the salsa and jalapenos. The roomie ordered the burrito and enchiladas. He seemed to enjoy them. We also got about four bags of chips and sides of pico. (I think they came with the tacos since I ordered four of them?) I didn't really eat the chips, but I liked throwing the pico on the tacos and nachos to give it an added element of freshness.

Overall, I though their tacos were okay. And priced average at less than $3 each. (Not sure if Postmates inflates item prices, but I don't think they do based on past experience.) With Postmates delivery fee special, it was a nice way to celebrate National Taco Day.
author: Elena N.

description:
I am eating low carb, so my fiance wanted to go to the sandwich shop next door i figured this was a better option. I went in and requested the platter Carne asada and prawn platter. This platter comes with rice and beans, so I asked if I can sub out the rice and beans, as they are not low carb, for an egg. She said, 'no it comes with rice and beans' . I then asked if I could pay extra for an egg instead of the rice and beans and was told, 'no, I have never made that before'... At this point we left and went nextdoor and the food was fantastic and not bathed in stupidity.


Clarification: they have eggs and breakfast items on the menu, and it was 9:30 on a Saturday morning so not unreasonable to cook an egg or ask to order eggs.
author: Patricia P.

description: I like this place if only because it is one of the few I have found in the Bay Area that has California burritos--after more than a decade of eating my way through them around San Diego, I've had to change my menu selections up north. The burritos are large and tasty, and the prices are fine. They also have pretty good (and huge) nacho plates. I've always ordered to go, and we've never waited long.
author: Matt C.

description:
I still ate my carnitas/ asada tacos, they were edible, but not tasty. My friend ordered Mahi tacos and could not finish them, the fish tasted like it had sat in the freezer for way too long..

Additionally, the interaction of the people running the place was a little rude. I'd not recommend this spot.
author: Garret P.

description:
So bad. The worst burrito place ever. I know I am spoiled living in the Mission where Mexican food is the best in town but La Playa Taqueria can't even cook their rice right. Yes, my shrimp burrito with refried beans was salty to the point I ate less than half, too wet, and the shrimp was not cooked enough, tasted cold, uncooked rice.
The same with my friends' carne asada burrito. Food is just not fresh. To add, lady at the register has a bad attitude, close to rude.
author: Katy E.

description:
cashier is very rude
super burrito is super dry
and it was like pulling teeth for extra salsa
dont come here
author: Michael K.

description: Horrible service and food. We tried to order online for pickup so we could just grab and go if they were busy, but when we arrived she just kept pointing to the screen saying she couldn't find our order, shrugged, and was very unhelpful. We had prepayed so we called eat24 and they tried to call the restaurant to figure it out. She refused to answer the phone and when we tried to get her to talk to them on my husband's phone, she refused as well. When she finally did answer their call, she still didn't believe that we had ordered anything. Eat 24 ended up giving us a refund, so we ordered in person and discovered that the food wasn't even good. It was so bland and I had many gristly, chewy pieces of meat in my burrito. I ended up only eating 1/3 of it. I would avoid this place.
author: Brittany M.

description: I have come here a couple of times when I have been by the Beach.  I really like the carnitas which come with salsa and chips and come in at under $6. Granted it isn't as good as places in the Mission but it is a lot better than what I'm used to in London.
author: Matt B.

description: Used to go here years ago when I lived in the neighborhood and it was fine. But these days, there's always rude service from the cashier. And they charge a service fee for using your credit/debit card, IN THIS DAY AND AGE, are you joking?! The food is serviceable, just ok, but the carne asada is not good. Given the cold, aloof service and upcharge for using my damn card, I won't return.
author: Cake M.

description:
Awful customer service from the lady who takes order. Dont expect any smile nor thank you.  I have been there twice and both times its the same rude lady.    Hey i am paying for my food, giving you a business; not begging for your food.   

The burritos are literally tasteless.   Their meat is very dry and flavorless.   Never will i return.
author: Janita s.

description: So tired of this place and the rude ladies who work there. When they take your order they act like your bugging them. And the lazy food perpetration is the worst. The steak they put in the tacos, burritos and quesadillas are the size of Legos and is tasteless. And don't bother asking for salt and lime to fix the flavoring unless you want to deal with more attitude. The only reason I attempted to eat here again and waste $18 for a cold carne asada burrito and quesadilla was because the pizza place was closed. Today is Thursday 8-24-17 @3:30. If you want a proper Mexican burrito with finely cut, seasoned carne asada don't go here. They will serve you half ass made chunks of meat that you cant chew, is cold and tasteless. I'm done giving this place a chance. Ive been here 5 times or so and have been disappointed every time.
author: Julia P.

description: The first two times I went here everything was peachy keen , then today 3/2 I just felt like I got terrible service and was back-mouthed given a dirty look and just in general felt discriminated against because I'm white , stay away from this place they wouldn't even give me more chips , when I asked the one lady working there turned to her friend and said something in Spanish then turned back to me and really rudely said "you want more chips I charge you for more chips" super rude , stay away from this place! They didn't even cook the quesadilla all the way through how do you mess up a quesadilla I mean come on .... warning warning stay away!!!
author: Luke R.

description: The Mexican woman cashier was racist and rude. I ordered two chicken tacos and she asked me if I wanted a bag and I said "yes, please" and she was like "what?" I was like "yes!". When my tacos was done, she just looked at me and I was like I asked for a bag and she was like you said no bag and then she goes ok, I'll give you a bag. But the funny thing is, the Mexican guy before me got his food order and she asked him if he wanted a bag and gave it to him all smiling. I should of threw her the 10 cent for the damn bag but I didn't want to be rude like her. Came here a few times back then but don't think I'll come back again! Reading all the reviews, she's so rude to everyone!
author: Wing C.

description: Simply not good food, and poorly prepared. My burrito was surprisingly cold- not a good sign for food safety
author: Robert S.

description:
The first time I went in there the lady who took my order was very rude, I thought she was having a bad day so I didn't say much and just ordered my food. I ordered shrimp tacos, didn't wait too long for it but the food was OK wasn't the best. 

The second time I went in and wanted to give this place another chance I was hoping it was someone else who can take my order but it was the same lady. I wanted to try something new so I took a little time to look at the menu. The first time she asked me what I wanted to order I said "I'm not ready to order yet." I wasn't done looking and decide what I want to get and she asked the second time "Hello???? Can I help you?" I got so annoyed, I wasn't even done looking at the menu and just walked out of the restaurant.
author: Amiee H.

description:
Temperamental place. Some days they answer the phone to take orders, other times they don't or say they are too busy(when go there around the same time I order my food there are only 2-3 people inside the place). 
They say they use postmates as delivery service but sometimes their menus are up and other times the menu disappears . 
It has happened many times. 
I use delivery service when my daughter is sick and wants a quesadilla so I use postmates. I wouldn't to go out with a sick child and expose her to rain wind or cold weather if she has a lousy cold. 

All in all, i wish this place would make up its mind . If you don't want to take orders, don't post your phone number or join postmates. 
Make up you mind!
author: Liza B.

description: Decent Mexican food. The tacos are the best thing on their menu. Generous portions and delicious fish tacos in particular. Minimal seating but we never have a hard time getting a seat.
author: Virginia C.

description:
Awful service, they literally kick people out while trying to eat. They close at 8:30 I guess? But at 835 they begin yelling at guests to get off the tables because they need to clean.
Food is ok but for sf can be better. So many great places in sf don't waste your time or money
author: Aaron R.

description: I was served spoiled refried beans with sour taste probably from day before unsafe food handling the food is of substandard quality already now this I would rate it rat food standard food poisoning warning beware
author: Andres C.

description:
I was craving a mission burrito but I had to settle for a sunset one. I gave la playa another shot at their burrito and they disappointed big time!! I got a shrimp and beef burrito had to pay an extra .80 for sour cream my burrito came out to $10!! All I was thinking walking home was this better be good!

I was half way through my burrito and still couldn't find the shrimps. All I ate was a bunch of lettuce and small bits of beef. So far not happy. I got to the second half and found small shrimps, looked like frozen shrimps. Then!!! I saw a hair literally stuck in my burrito. I tried to pull it out and it wasn't budging! Look at the video I took of the burrito HAIR! I didn't know burritos had hair! Ugh gag
author: Karen T.

description: Extremely rude service. I ordered a carne asada burrito. Other places usually ask what kind of wrap, beans, and toppings. Here, they didn't even ask and no eye contact. No smile. Nothing. Bland food. Not returning.
author: Michael D.

description: The lady and the other 2 guys just watch us 2 separate patrons stand outside while they talk and get ready inside, if your sign says you open at 11am then u should at least let us stand inside to look at menu while u get ready (they didn't let us in till 11:10am), this is why this place only has 3 stars.......someone needs to open another taqueria and make this place sweat, service completely sucks, should of went to yonkers, way better service but wife wanted tacos at 11am, I wonder if they are the owners, if they are then that's sad
author: Johnny H.

description: I ordered nachos with refried beans. The first time they came with carne asada and no beans. I called to inform them of the mistake. No one answered all seven times I called. They remade my order. This time with black beans instead of refried beans. Close, but not quite.
author: Jillian G.

description:
Have you ever had that experience of where you're with a friend, and you're about to go into a place, and your friend tries to open the door (of course by turning the doorknob) but they find it locked.  Do you feel compelled that you must also try the door handle, just to confirmed that it is in fact locked.  Then you too find it locked and confirm that your friend was right.  Yeah, that was me with this place.  I've read the reviews, but I was compelled to try it for myself.  In the end I shoulda just listened to all the reviews.  It also makes me question the management of a place when there are numerous bad reviews and not once has the business owner replied to or addressed any of them.  Oh well, onward...
When I went in the place was empty.  As many of the reviews say, I was met by a woman at the register who was utterly indifferent to the fact  that I'd chosen to mosey on into her shop for a lunch.  Took my order, said "Here or to go?" and took my cash.  I'd forgot to get a drink so I said, "Oh sorry can you also add a bottled water?" She didn't reply, just got the water and apparently added the price difference to whatever I paid without saying anything.  With indifferent people that chose to work in the service industry, I always make a point of saying many "Thank yous" to see if they're just having a bad day or if they're just in the wrong job for their personality.  I offered three or four "Thanks'" during this encounter and got nary a "you're welcome" or anything close in return. 
 Two steak tacos came out shortly thereafter.  Seemed to be a relatively generous amount of ok quality meat  with some chips on the side.  The meat was really, really watery though, and the juices overflowed onto the plate making the tortillas wet and useless at holding their contents.  It didn't taste horrible - nor great, just extremely blah.   They have no salsa bar! The whole place just kinda feels like their phoning it in.
author: H K.

description: Food is good but the lady at the cashier is such a Bitch!   She needs to put her attitude away! Especially in such an amazing neighborhood
author: jay rock the bay r.

description: If you want mediocre Mexican food, this is the place.  Cashier has a bad attitude too.
author: Me Like Good Food S.

description: Cashier was rude. She didn't let a man order food while carry his dog just because she said the dog was going to bite her.
author: Citlally D.

description: Ordered tacos and they are nothing to write home about. The shrimp taco lacked flavor, the SHRIMP WERE NOT CLEANED and over cooked. The chicken taco was too salty and all of the tortillas are bagged not fresh. Cleanliness is important especially when you are cooking food professionally.
author: Celeste B.

description:
I've always wanted to try this Mexican restaurant and I finally had the chance today.

I ordered the super burrito (steak) with regular nachos. I would say that their burritos were average and their nachos were okay too - overall an average experience.

One thing that was a turn off was the point of contact with the female employee. She seemed like she didn't like her job and was giving a death stare.
author: Aj C.

description: Okay, the service here is not fabulous but having lived in the neighborhood, I got a feel on what to order hehe. When you come here, try the nachos supreme to go with polo or asada, they literally fill it up to the top & its great! If you're around on weekends, order one of the breakfast burritos. I LOVE the "Spanish" or "Mexican" due to the sauce that they use... delicious!
author: Adriel D.

description:
Not that bad of a Taqueria. Came here today because I was in the mood for some Carnitas. I walked in and saw the GIANT menu up on the wall. I went with my gut and ordered a SUPER BURRITO with carnitas. That is always a default choice for me.

The place is not that big but there is a fair amount of seating. There are some cool portraits on the wall. This place is very festive in vibe which is nice. There is seating near the window on the stools. Good place to get some food and enjoy your meal.

Parking might be a tad difficult. This area tends to get very busy around lunchtime which can making parking a pain. Also, pay attention to the street parking signs in the area because the last thing you want to get is a parking ticket, over $50 now!!!!! 

The burrito itself was more than I expected. The jalapenos were a great addition to this burrito. This was the first time that I have ordered a burrito and I did not have to ask for jalapenos. THIS IS A SUPER PLUS!!! This just added so much flavor and taste to the burrito. About halfway through the burrito I was beginning to feel the affect on my stomach. Feeling full and sleepy. Long story short...finishing the burrito caused me to take a power NAP! 

Cool spot. Made my day better.
author: Robert F.

description:
I like the spicy Ortega burrito and I have been eating here whenever I am in town. The service is not very good . Charging 50c for each container of sauce is just too much when I have already paid for extra sauce. I paid about $10 with a tip for the burrito.

I should look for other alternatives nearby.
author: Sid P.

description: I called to make an order 20 minutes before close but no one picked up the phone so I made the order on Yelp and got a confirmation email 15 minutes before close. I went to pick up the order but the door was locked and the employees were cleaning up and would not let me in. I kept knocking on the window until finally one guy opened the door and said they are closed and that they didn't get any order. This is no way to run a business. Set a cutoff time and don't allow orders to get made if you're already closing. Wasting people's time. Zero stars.
author: Hugh M.

description:
Aaaverage. Cashier service is poor and inattentive. No gratitude, no respect. I had trouble opening their old door in the morning and when I asked for assistance, the female cashier, clearly annoyed I interrupted her conversation with the line cooks, she huffed, "estúpida" as she elephant-stomped towards the door. I was shocked.

Food is basic. Granted, we did get breakfast burritos. But based on the reviews, I felt they were the safest options. Tortilla was nicely steamed but ingredients were average.

I bought salsa from Dimitri's next door because they didn't come with complimentary chips and salsa.
author: Juliet P.

description: To make a long story short, read my review at https://www.yelp.com/biz/celias-by-the-beach-san-francisco?hrid=QVgz6oQ7UZPkOdrtB2TItQ "Celia's by the Beach" which I'm very thankful to Gohar Z. on 3/23/17 for recommending.  That member is right on the mark!  There are MUCH BETTER places than LPT for Mexican in the Richmond/Sunset areas.
author: Frugal C.

description: They have the best chile rellenos when they have them. I went back and back still a week later still no chile rellenos. Very disappointing.
author: Pet R.

description: The only reason I go here and left three stars is because I eat if for hangover food.  The meat is bland and perfect when you have a wonky stomach.  Rice is always super dry.  They almost always forget/mess something up... And the ladies always working the counter are mildly pleasant at best.  I'm assuming it's only still open because it's the only Mexican spot in the area.  Mehhhhhhh.
author: Ems G.

description:
So my friend said they have awesome fish tacos. We were hungry, this sounded promising, so off we went. 

We both had fish tacos. At about 2.75 each, they were slightly bigger & heavier than most other places. Two managed to extinguish my hunger, sill leaving room for say .... a donut @ Twisted, on Noreiga & 19th.
http://www.yelp.com/biz/twisted-donuts-and-coffee-san-francisco?hrid=XxegAlEXswm9WrGwD1zw8A 

I always expect to taste a seasoned, deep fried crispy fish whenever I order fish tacos, but at La Playa, the flavor was masked by the pile of shredded cabbage or slaw & sauce. It was heavy and filling.... but lacked any actual fish flavor. 

My friend later admitted to me he was drunk when he had it before, and maybe that's why he remembered them to be so good. Hmmm... vital piece of information you left out, eh buddy?? 

Seating is mostly at the counter & stools, facing Noreiga St. The service we received was lacking. The woman at the register had no... repeat, no facial expressions. No thanks you's, no your order will be right up... she only told us the total, that's it. I thought only authentic Chinese restaurants were like that. I was wrong!

Very average taco, served by a less than average woman. It did the job, but I won't miss this place. I haven't tried anything else, but don't have the urge to come back.
author: James L.

description: I was excited when a taqueria opened up in the neighborhood, but unfortunately, every visit I have had there has been a disappointment.  The food is mediocre (there's usually a few pieces of fat/chewy inedible pieces of beef in my carne asada burrito), the service is terrible.  The worst part is the woman who takes your order--she never smiles and very unfriendly and rude.  After today's visit, I decided it will be my last.  It's really a shame since the Pizza Place, Devil's Teeth, Papa Mak's, Yonkers and Gus's Market are such great places on Noriega.  Sadly, I will drive to another tacqueria when I'm hankering for a burrito.
author: Eva T.

description:
A good neighborhood taqueria.  The options have a surftown ocean vibe to them, which makes it fit in very well. 

I've tried their California Burrito, Breakfast Burrito, and regular burrito.  All were good. 

Beach and breakfast burrito make for a perfect combo. 

Plenty of seating inside.  Or order to go and eat down by the waves.
author: Joseph B.

description: I don't know if this rude lady that everyone is talking about still works here. But the cashier is super nice to me and I've been here over a dozen times. Maybe those are old comments. But the food is really good and realllllly affordable. Like. McDonalds is more expensive than this.
author: Nate N.

description: I yelped about this place being not so good before. But this is a different situation entirely. It was a while ago, during the Noriega street fair actually. I came in because my son was hungry, and loves rice and pinto beans (which you can't screw up) so I got him an order. I literally had my hands full with other stuff so I asked for a bag. Her exact words "bags are for people who buy burritos." Really lady? I am a customer who bought Rice and beans? That doesn't qualify for bag giving?! Lol I laugh about it now because it seems so petty. But at the time it pissed me off.' Because here I am, a Mother with a "hangry" child, hands full, and a paying customer. And you refuse to give me a bag?! Smh this place not only has flavorless burritos but a rude woman working the counter. Maybe she doesn't have kids and couldn't sympathize, or maybe she was just following a ridiculous policy.
author: Monica R.

description: I recently went in and asked for  2 chicken burritos  ( $18+) for my kids and a side of beans for me to eat there. My kids got their orders and mine was was boiling hot beans in a plastic tub with a side of corn tortillas wrapped in aluminum. I asked if I could please have my order on a plate since I don't like plastic tasting beans. She dumped the beans in the plastic tub on a plate. I again asked if I could have a fresh spoonful of beans on the plate offering to pay again. The lady at the cashier threw $1.58 back at me and told me nev er to come back again. Really??? Is it so hard to put a spoonful of beans on a plate for a customer eating there who just coughed up $18 plus??? Very illiterate and rude people working the cash register. The food at best is mediocre. My family will pass.
author: Roxana C.

description:
This Mexican spot in the outer sunset is ok, and I do appreciate that they include grilled chiles in their burritos. 

Pros: Good salsa, big portions, decent prices. 

Cons: cramped dining space, odd enchilada sauce on their surfing wet burrito, and took long to get food, carnitas lacked flavor. 

I would give it another chance. Shouldn't have ordered the wet burrito, wonder how their carne asada tastes.
author: Marlon T.

description: Good portions and consistent food. Shrimp tacos, or veggie burrito, ask for green hot sauce - it's tasty. I've tried their carne asada a few times and each time it was grisly. My husband loves the nachos and 3 pepper burrito.
author: Misty H.

description: I've been here multiple times and every time the food has been amazing. My top choice would be the cheese enchiladas, but I've tasted quite a few of their dishes and they are all great quality. We usually order take out and they have the order ready in less than ten minutes. The ladies that run the place are very kind and customer service oriented as well! Definitely recommend!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Beyond shitty even for the price. The cashier was beyond rude.
I ordered a chicken supreme burrito with no beans and a huge chunk of the meat was still raw with the fat attached to it. 
If you want Mexican food three times as good for a few bucks extra just go to Celia's by the Beach.
author: Gohar Z.

description: This place has always been alright if I really wanted to burrito but didn't want to leave the neighborhood. Last night I got really bad food poisoning from here and I'm sure it's because of the meat. When I was eating I noticed something different about the carnitas but didn't really care because I was hungry. I wouldn't really call the meat in my burrito carnitas though. It was like regular pork chop meat (but that's not the real issue). The point is I got food poisoning and that's not cool
author: Christina V.

description:
Live in the neighborhood, so I needed a quick fix for some Mex.! I didn't want to drive to El Burrito Ex., which is awesome.
I was very disappointed with the girl at the counter, she just handed me the food and didn't say thank you after I gave a tip.
I ordered a burrito and it was filled with chicken (not a bad thing), but no cheese and the rice tasted like wild rice??? WTF 
The quesadilla was the only thing semi good. I will never go there again!!!
author: J s.

description: Seriously, fuck this place. Overly salty food and employees. Don't understand how people can be so miserable so consistently when serving food to people. It definitely reflects on the quality of food they put out. Worst burrito I've ever had, and I've had plenty in my relatively short life.
author: David B.

description:
Not nearly as good as el burrito express on taraval....

I ordered the steak supreme nachos: huge portion but the steak was off and dry (maybe it was in the warmer for too long?).
And the wet steak burrito: the red sauce had a nice spicy kick to it but it was the same dry steak ;(

Service? The lady could have been nicer. She seemed annoyed when taking my order... Didn't crack a smile.
author: Liz N.

description:
Shrimp burrito: very average. At least the shrimp wasn't over cooked, but the whole burrito was too mushy. Too much watered down chipotle sauce and soggy lettuce. Beans and rice were aite. The pico de gallo they gave me with my burrito and chips were really bland. It didn't really taste like anything to be honest.

Portion wise, It was decent. Burrito was definitely on the skinnier size. Was able finish one by myself and I'm a pretty petite individual. Definitely have room for more food as well.
author: Sandy K.

description: The burrito and chips were very yummy . The three peppers burrito is my recommendation.  But the free water........ It smells and tastes like soap.. :P
author: Kaitlyn H.

description: Great establishment! My boyfriend and I go here all the time and are always pleased with the service. Have gotten various things on the menu and would especially recommend the nachos! Parking is pretty easy and you can even get it to go and eat at the beach!
author: Skye L.

description: The service is poor at best.  The lady at the counter is rude and unfriendly.  The food is decent but this is San Francisco, you can find better burrito places for sure!
author: Peter L.

description: La Playa Taqueria's fish tacos and burritos are good! It's nice to get Mission style burritos by the beach.
author: Amber S.

description: Best chorizo breakfast burrito ever! Huge, tasty, perfect. One of those gems in the sunset not to be missed. Highly recommended !
author: Eric B.

description:
breakfast burrito had dried up crunchy rice and not much eggs.
also was asked to pay $.50 for some extra salsa on a $8 burrito...
author: Jason C.

description:
I have to admit I am not a Yelper and I hate writing a bad review for a small business.  I use Yelp a lot for research, and I only write reviews if the service/ product is AMAZING, or if it is terrible.  Well, this experience was terrible. I even reached out to the owner of the restaurant once by Yelp private messenger and also by phone leaving my number with the staff.  No response through either attempts.  So here is my review:  

I ordered a seafood burrito to go.  I got home, cut it in half, ate nearly to the bottom of the burrito and I bit down on something hard- really hard.  I thought I had broken my tooth.  Upon further examination I discovered it was a ROCK.  That a pebble was inside my burrito.  It was horrible and disgusting.  

I am not sure this was by accident and that the restaurant/ food is just that dirty and gross that random pieces of pebble end up in the food they serve people?  Or if was the passive aggressive work of the super unfriendly woman at the register who I did not tip on this visit because she was extra annoyed and mean to me since my crime was that I came into the restaurant she works at and I made an order.  And I ALWAYS tip people and restaurants since I put myself through college waiting tables.  But on top of the stone in my burrito, the customer service there is awful.   You might be tempted to go there since the Sunset has a high lack of Mexican food- but I advise you against it.....
author: nat t.

description:
I went into La Playa Taqueria today around 3:30 - Note to people working there: There are white people who understand Spanish, so..."La Gorda" will not be back.
A bad attitude, coupled with insulting your clientele by thinking they can't understand your base level of Spanish, all of that served up with an unimpressive burrito - I'll never go back, and I'll be sure to share my experience with others.
Not cool.
author: Karla S.

description: The food is just okay, pretty bland. The real issue is the woman in the front who is incredibly rude and her attitude certainly doesn't make the mediocre food taste any better. I have gone here plenty of times, enough to know that she wasn't just having a bad day, and after reading other reviews I know it's not just me she is like this with. When ordering I feel rushed, and if you have any questions/ modifications don't expect her to listen. I would easily look past it if the food was great, but the entire experience from ordering to finishing the meal is a waste of time and money.
author: Ali K.

description: I went there once and never going back. The cashier was really rude and then she yelled at this mother with her daughter. They were arguing over the size of the burrito. The lady wanted a smaller size for her child and the lady kept saying "no" because they didn't have that size and she kept yelling in a rude tone. She also skipped my order and took someones else's order behind me. I was so upset. The cashier even made eye contact with me. ALSO THE LADY GAVE ME FROZEN SALSA. FROZEN SALSA. Their salsa is NOT fresh. Very upsetting. I would give negative stars. Don't come here.
author: Jenny F.

description:
Recently passed through La Playa Taqueria to revisit prior opinions.

Orders come with chips and salsa. Steak and shrimp burrito was pretty good. For the price and portion size it's a good value. The burrito could be even better with some additional flavor thrown in. If La Playa Taqueria were to start including a flavorful hot sauce with each order that would be a great way to bring up the burritos to the next level.

Quesadilla with added shrimp was quite good. We were happy to get both guacamole and sour cream along with it. Tortilla is flavorful, can distinctly pick up the flavor of cheese with it and the shrimp compliments well. The seasonings the chef splashed over shrimp while cooking came through. 

There was a different staff member at the register than I've seen on prior trips who was friendly and efficiently kept the line moving. Some of the comment concerns regarding unfriendly staff may have been addressed and improved on.

I'm deducting a star due to past experiences where staff have locked the front door during posted business hours and started closing early, ignored surprised patrons at the door in the process. Life happens and there may be cases where it's necessary. A sign on the door explaining the situation would go a long way. To some degree I consider La Playa Taqueria undependable and a second-tier option due to finding the place closing during business hours. It will take some time to rebuild trust. 

Considering price, portion size, tastiness, and convenient location I would give La Playa Taqueria 4 stars. If the friendliness shown on this trip and dependable hours holds could be the best burrito spot this side of the Mission. Especially if they expand on the hot sauce offerings!
author: David G.

description: Food is ok. Mostly 3 stars for the attitude from the later at the register. I was ordering and asking some questions as it was my first time and she shook her several times at me, impatient and frustrated. I asked her if she played poker. She said no, and I said good because you don't hide your feelings very well.
author: Nathan S.

description: this place has given me the best farts i've ever had in my life. 10/10 A++ would bang burrito. go get some!
author: Lars A.

description: I've only ordered from there twice, and have been telling my parents about it. I might as well eat there since I'm from the neighborhood! My favorite is the Shrimp & Steak Burrito.
author: Julio B.

description: We're from south San Diego and get our fill of good Mexican food close to the border ... with that said, this is really good Mexican food in SF!  I read previous reviews and do understand the counter service could be better.
author: Marc C.

description:
"Cada vez que me encuentro cada vez más sombrío sobre la boca; cada vez que se trata de una húmeda, noviembre lluvioso en mi alma; cada vez que me encuentro involuntariamente pausa antes de almacenes de ataúd, y cerrando la marcha de cada funeral me encuentro; y sobre todo cada vez que mi hipoglucemias conseguir una mano tan superior a mí, que requiere un fuerte principio moral para impedirme deliberadamente entrar en la calle, y metódicamente golpear sombreros de la gente fuera - entonces, me cuenta Es hora de llegar a Taquería La Playa una como pronto como pueda." - Hernan Melville

Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul; whenever I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses, and bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever my hypos get such an upper hand of me, that it requires a strong moral principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street, and methodically knocking people's hats off - then, I account it high time to get to La Playa Taqueria as soon as I can.

I was born the afternoon of Good Friday on a not-so-rugged bluff of land called "Costa Mesa." I lived on land that was so pretty, with views so robust, the area's original Spanish land grantee, Diego Sepulveda, put his Adobe mere feet away. She's California's 'coastal table,' eighty feet above sea level overlooking Newport Beach, with view that includes Santa Catalina Island and Saddleback Mountain and I come from Dutch people who trapped their way into this country centuries before the Mayflower. 


As I make my way, I'm reminded of a conversation I had with the Vicomte Audoin de Dampierre as we walked among the vines for his eponymous Champagne at his eponymous chateau on eponymous dirt. I asked what it felt like to bear the name of the land and everything which comes from it. He says he can feel every one of the 900 years his family has tread the soil there and that he does not feel divorced from the land, the vines, the wine, the village or the chateau.  Like mon ami, the Viscount, I consider no man to be any different than the soil he walks upon. The Earth is our mother and so my Mother country is Mexico. The food of my heart is Mexican food. 

Right now, I'm going to walk upon a couple blocks of this soil to La Playa and get a burrito. Probably carnitas with black beans. I'll be back in a little while to tell you how that goes. If you don't hear from me for what seems a long time, it might be that I never made it back and the great shroud of the sea rolls on as it has for the last 5000 years. That or something else. Back soon with the word on the food, dear reader. Soon.


 THAT WAS BEST FUCKING CARNITAS I'VE EVER HAD.
author: Paul K.

description: I used to go here once a week at least since I live nearby. One day I walked in to order and said hello to the lady at the register. She replied by stepping back from the register, looking directly at me while she raised her voice and started yelling at me in Spanish. She would not take my order. I stood there stunned for a minute or so until I realized she was not going to serve me. I walked out and will never go back. I have never been so disrespected at a restaurant in my whole life. This place is dead to me.
author: Graham W.

description:
Wow, 7 bucks for chicken nachos & they forgot the chicken. I'm with my kids & distracted of course, didn't realize the food was ready and its on the counter, no hey nachos ready or eye contact to let know, nothing. Have to get the lady's attention & then let's me know it's sitting there.

Won't be spending another dime in this place
author: Parker S.

description: I really love this place. It is not my ATF taco spot, but I like them nonetheless. Baja tacos are my fav. Their rice and beans are salty but good.I always get the plate. The salad is good. I prefer this place to any other in the neighborhood. Prices are decent too. Staff is usually friendly and interactive.
author: Bella B.

description: Solid taqueria in outer sunset. If you can't get to the mission, then this is a good bet. Their carnitas burrito and shrimp burrito are pretty good. Take your burrito down by the beach or sit outside and eat.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Took away one star because the cashier was pretty surly. That said, GREAT shrimp tacos!! Wonderful green/avocado salsa--reminded me that I don't know what they are making green salsa out of in other places but this was this first time in what felt like a long while since I've said "that's what a tomatillo tastes like!"

The Baja style fish taco wasn't as good as shrimp. They made the cabbage into almost a coleslaw, which was strange. But it wasn't bad. The kid had carnitas and really loved that. Highly recommend this place--and check out Noriega produce while you're there, great place as well.
author: jennifer k.

description: honestly i'm not quite sure why this taqueria doesn't have a higher rating, but regardless of what the three star rating says, i love this place! So far i've only tried the enchiladas and burritos but they give you a really good amount of food whenever you order. one of my favorite taquerias by far, highly recommended :)
author: Iona R.

description:
I feel like an abused person..I keep going back and get the same disrespectful treatment.
One of the women who works there repeatedly is grumpy . When I asked for extra salsa , she told me I already had two. When I said I would pay for it, ( less than one ounce) , no response...just a begrudgingly aquiescence . 
Got home and the little salsa containers were half filled . 
Come on ! 
The food is fair to middling but it is close  to my place. Seinfeld's soup nazi was more entertaining. But we are not in New York. We are in my city, San Francisco, where courtesy and good service should reign. 
Fix this!
author: L. P.

description:
Ordered steak and shrimp burrito: beef was overcooked, shrimp was pretty good. Overall, it's not as juicy and delicious as my favorite burrito to go place(which is located in Glen park but it's too far for me lazy girl to have a quick lunch).
I don't have desire to go back next time unless I am craving for burrito and too lazy to drive. I will continue to find good burrito spots around sunset. 
Service was not good( poker face woman without any facial expression, not welcoming)
author: Noktong H.

description: Place is rude and doesn't care about their customers. I WAS a local to this place but not anymore. I arrived at about 835-840 because I was rushing to get a dinner before heading home. They tell me they were closed. I asked don't they close at 9 and they tell me they weren't done cleaning. That's why they were closed when they specifically suppose to close at 9. Reminder it was only 835!  That's plenty of time to make another order. They were still making orders for other customers already! They obviously don't care bout customers and only care about leaving as soon as they were done.
author: Raymond P.

description: Horrible, careless service. In a hurry so I made an order for pickup, they lost the order, refused to make it and wouldn't refund what I already paid on eat 24. Simplest way to identify a worthless business.
author: Valued C.

description: This place is exactly what you need the day after a long night. The chorizo burrito and the carne asada california burrito are the truth!!!!!!
author: Shaun P.

description:
For a beachy restaurant in San Francisco you'd think some vegan nachos wouldn't be met with such a disgusting look of derision. When we are the only ones there you'd think they could walk our sad pintos, heavy guacamole and 10 chips out to us. Nope, the cashier stood at the counter yelling for us. 

This was a neighborhood favorite when I lived here. No more nostalgia visits. That sucked.
author: Emily C.

description:
Compared to many of the taquerias that I've been to, this is probably the smallest one that I've visited and ate at. You can also say that to many of the businesses in the outer Sunset are limited with space as well. 

For lunch I had one of the taqueria's popular burritos: The Three Pepper Burrito. For $6.75, the burrito has Grilled Chicken or Grilled Steak, Roasted Green, Red, Poblano Peppers, Onions, Rice, Beans, Cheese, Avocado, and Salsa in a grilled Flour Tortilla. Not many places make this kind of burrito. And I like La Playa's version. The Grilled Chicken was grilled and cooked nicely. The Peppers add a nice kick with the other common ingredients in the greasy burrito. My burrito: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VhvVzBxyTkDKV1pFT1YwfA?select=t4Tr6TCHbnWzWKN36dS97g

I also added a cold bottle of Sidral Mundet apple soda with my meal. 

The lady that took my order was a bit stunned with my fluent speaking of Spanish. 

"I've been to over 300 Taquerias and studied the language, I've better know how to speak the language!"   

Despite the low ratings, I like the food here and will come here once again.
author: Matt G.

description:
Food here is actually pretty good.  A good California burrito and decent breakfast burritos.  A really good variety and different from the mission/chipotle style that other places do.

It's service is mediocre to awful.  They don't seem to care about doing a good job.  They open late and close early.  One time they left me on hold on the phone.  So if you're able to get their attention, you can order food.
author: R L.

description:
not sure why I keep coming back here.
major breakfast burrito fail recently here.
well, at least this time I can say that I was starving like Marvin because I skipped dinner the night before.
the mexican breakfast burrito said clearly on the menu that it consisted of GROUND beef. but i got bland over cooked chopped beef. i expected seasoned ground beef. the scrambled eggs were overcooked. and the salsa was bland and flavorless.
Do I have to go to Mission for good mexican food?
author: Jeff W.

description:
This is my goto taqueria when I'm craving for Mexican eats near home. Their burritos, quesadillas, and tacos are pretty good like the many places I've tried in the Mission District or other taquerias out in the Sunset District. The prices are reasonable and the service is pretty quick depending on the line of orders ahead of you. I've never seen a long line of people since this place is hidden way out on the end of Noriega but I'm sure there would be one if it was in the Heart of the Mission. 

The only downside of this place is that the place is small with only a few tables and a standing counter by the window.  I don't think they have Agua Fresca or other juices but there's a veggie store, bar, liquor store, and mini mart on the same block.
author: B N.

description:
The shrimp tacos are the one and only reason I come here. You might think that Underdogs is the only decent taqueria in the Outer Sunset. Well my friends, this is simply not the case.

Get the shrimp tacos (or the shrimp taco platter depending on how hungry you are) and make sure they don't skimp on the chipotle aioli. It's LIFE CHANGING.

Their hours can be wonky on any given night, so be sure to call before you visit. 

PS - call and order ahead - there is zero ambiance unless you want to grab a beer and sit outside, but they're efficient and chances are your order will be ready when you arrive.
author: Katie A.

description:
This little spot on Noriega is solid for burritos at least.  I stopped in and tried out the chilie verde burrito.  The pork was cooked well, and the rice and beans were pretty standard.  The green salsa could have been a little more spicy, but that's just like my opinion....man.  Big Lebowski references aside, I had an overall positive lunch experience.  

The menu had some pretty good looking breakfast burritos as well.  It was sad times a couple of days later when I stopped by in the am only to find that they don't open until 11:00, and I wouldn't be able to try one.
author: Josh M.

description: Ordered the California burrito & it honestly caught me by surprise. Didn't feel like looking at the menu so I looked at reviews for suggestions & saw a CA burrito. Had no idea there were fries in the burrito and it just added to the overall texture of the burrito!!! I absolutely loved it, came with chips and salsa, which was a pleasant little side. The service was decent, I didn't expect it to be a full service restaurant so it met my expectations! The seats weren't the most comfortable nor did the tables look extremely clean but then again it's a very local shop so it was expected. Would definitely come again and try something new!
author: Jennifer Z.

description: They got bomb ass burritos and I ain't even high yet. That's how you know it's bomb af.
author: Kayla D.

description: Food is below average, and counter service is cartoonishly rude.  Who knows, maybe she owns the joint?  She is miserable and even if the food was better, having to order with her again is a complete deterrent.  Too many other good things to eat on that block with really nice people to deal with this beauty.
author: Linda C.

description: This place doesn't even deserve a single star. Poor quality in food. Paid 12.00 for a burrito that just came out watery and over packed with rice and beans. I even tipped 3.00 to make sure that the food came out superb. Awful. Never coming back to the place. My burrito would have been better used as a flesh light.
author: Alex D.

description:
Previously I wrote about how much I liked the Chili Rellenos Burrito but experienced gastric distress each time I sampled it. I may have used the phrase, "burrito rooter" to describe the experience.

Turns out I'm lactose intolerant, so I've updated my review to four stars (it's the local burrito joint, tried and true, nothing special, nice people), sorry guys.
author: Alf W.

description:
If you're out at Ocean Beach and you're really craving a burrito..do yourself a favor and just use door dash or grub hub. I live in the neighborhood and have given this place 3 tries (since it's the neighborhood spot) but it's just terrible. Bad quality meats and without decent house salsas. Ask for spicy salsa or ask for mild, they'll give you the same little container of diced tomatoes and cilantro. Rice is generally flavorless.
In the chicken burrito I found more questionable parts of meat than you would at a KFC, I wouldn't even trust giving it to my dog. Same with the steak. And the nachos leave a whole lot to be desired. All around bad experiences on everything. Sorry. But it's just awful.
author: Jimmy S.

description: Went there the other day to order some food to go. Once we got there the lady working there seemed a little bit unwelcoming, didn't mind it too much just wanted to get my food, I ordered a California burrito and the meat tasted bad, my wife got carne asada tacos and the meat tasted bad aswell.
author: Jose P.

description:
OK. Thing is, I don't really like burritos. I never get them, but my boyfriend eats them...mmm...pretty much daily. 

So...inevitable that I finally jump on the burrito burro. Which, in this case, was at La Playa Taqueria. 

To be fair, please note the chicas working were SUPER SWEET. 

However.

Oh...*sigh*. 

I can't even describe how inexplicably inedible this burrito was. Carnitas? NO. I think CAT-nitas. OMG. 

I wanna like this place. I wanna like this place. I wanna LOVE this place. It's the only taqueria close to our house...which is way out (think 41st and Noriega...so yes...way out). But, alas, I cannot.

Anyway...have you been to Casalita's on Church??? They rock. SO HARD.
author: Elle N M.

description:
I usually never write bad reviews. But this place made me feel unwelcome. The lady at the cashier was so inattentive and just wanted to get the order over with. Then she'll just be on her phone the entire time. 

I ordered the fish taco, it's was okay. But I've had better. But not bad, pretty nice joint. But don't think I'll be back if I see the same employee at the register.
author: Channary S.

description:
I have been coming to La Playa for almost 9 years and confidently say it is my favorite burrito in San Francisco outside of El Farolito and La Taqueria on mission. 

Highlight items- 

Shrimp Tacos: 9.5/10
Chorizo Burrito: 9/10
Carnitas Burrito: 8.5/10 

That being said, I look at other reviews that do not hold it in as high regard and find that frequently the times when customers left unsatisfied, is when they ordered something other than a taco or burrito. It is a taqueria, and while they offer an array of items, do yourself a favor and order tacos or a burrito - rarely do they disappoint. 

Their shrimp tacos are truly fabulous and the chorizo burrito has become a regular with my frequent visits. 

In short, the food is great, a strong member of the powerhouse of food that we call Noriega and 46th street - between La Playa, The Pizza Place, Noriega Produce (Gus' Market?) and Devils Teeth Bakery, we are lucky to have such awesome food in such a small radius!
author: Kyle L.

description: Mediocre service.  Don't ever call in because they will add food to your order and won't refund you, it has happened twice now.
author: Kyle N.

description:
I've come to the conclusion that if I want something resembling a Mission quality burrito I probably have to head out to the Mish to get one.

It's not to say the taquerias out in the Sunset are terrible, but in terms of flavor and freshness, they just can't compare.

And after trying the veggie burrito at La Playa Taqueria, my fears have been confirmed.

I ordered their super veggie burrito and, as with other places in the Sunset, it was all right.

I would have appreciated some more rice and beans because it was thin in the middle and more tortilla than anything else at the end. 

And by the way, what is the deal with the chips?

I get it if an accompanying side is so outstanding that it can be served alone.
Otherwise, you really should include it or at least ask if they'd want some.

McDonald's french fries, for example, can stand alone because folks don't necessarily need or want a burger or sandwich to go with it.

That being said I haven't had chips and salsa so exceptional that I'd want to eat them by themselves.

Did I totally just sound like a grumpy old man there?
What's happening to me?

Next thing you know my reviews will start off with, "I remember the days when a dollar could buy you a . . . "
author: Dan B.

description:
Come here if you're looking for pretty good Mexican food but don't expect a five star treatment from the cashier. Me and boyfriend found this place due to its close proximity to his house and will continue to come here out of convenience but I strongly recommend to NEVER come here within the hour before closing. 

On two separate occasions, we have arrived  between 7:00-7:15 (they close at eight on Sunday's) and we were told that since they were closing, all orders must be to go. The lady at the front not only kicked out paying customers who already had their food and wanted to eat but started sending people away as early as 7:30 saying that they were already closed. Silly me, I assumed that if went to a restaurant during normal business hours, I'd have the opportunity to sit and enjoy my food. What kind of establishment kicks people out 30-60 minutes before closing? 

La Playa Taqueria, your food is decent but your service sucks.

Ps. She also refused to give us any chips while we were waiting for our food :(
author: Jourdan A.

description:
This used to my favorite taqueria in the area.   It keeps going downhill, but today I decided to try a fish taco.    I got it to go.   I bit into a huge piece of overcooked fish skin.

That's it, I'm done with this place.
author: Eric G.

description:
Really great food but the customer service from one of the ladies is terrible. She is nothing but rude and not willing to make accommodations when others who have helped us have gone above and beyond. She defiantly makes it hard to come back, and hurts her coworkers tips.

Just got home to a freezing cold burrito, I live 5 minutes away and it feels like it was pulled out of the refrigerator and put in the bag. I will never return after that. If I wanted a microwaved burrito I would've bought something pre packaged.
author: Jeff P.

description: We were hankering for a small meal so we figured we finally give this spot a go and get some tacos. I had the shrimp and fish taco whereas my fiancé had the carne asada and fish taco. As for my meal, I thought the shrimp was really well prepared and loved the taco. The fish was very crispy which is the way I actually prefer it and the coleslaw mix tasted incredibly fresh. Where we went a bit wrong was that the carne asada was burnt. Honestly though given that our other tacos were solid, we're inclined to go back to this shop because it seemed on par.
author: Shauna S.

description: No flavor, meat not well cook or over cook, salsas not good... I think the only good thing was the chips by itself, not coming back !
author: Leilani R.

description: 1 reason to come here. They have a California burrito that is worthy of San Diego. It's bigger than Santana's California burrito and juicer. I've been eating SD burritos for over 30 years and I could never find a good quality sd burrito in sf, until now. They do 4 of the 5 tenets of a SD burrito. They grill the meat after you order (no subway line), they grill the tortilla ( not steamed ), no rice and beans in your meat log, they use shredded yellow cheese, but unfortunately they wrap the burrito in foil ( parchment is king cause it doesn't steam your nice grilled tortilla). Not a big deal on the foil because I usually eat there. If your looking for a California burrito this is the place. You're welcome my fellow San Diegans.
author: Peter T.

description: Friendly service that gets your order ready quickly! This place has become a bit of a regular for us with their delicious carnitas. I've had the super burrito and burrito mojado. They are large sized burritos that they easily customize for you if you want to make all changes.
author: Gaby E.

description: I was in the mood for breakfast burritos and all i got was a bacon burrito with egg shells in ity. ughhh. i wont be going there fo a while
author: B A.

description: This lave Is a Very small joint but believe me lots of meat on their food I love it! Stopped by with my friend and she enjoyed as well
author: Diana S.

description:
I stopped in here before heading to a movie with my friend. 

I ordered two fish tacos and one carnitas taco. We poured ourselves some water from the water pitcher in the refrigerator and took our seats. 

Our food was brought to our table pretty fast. 

I tried the carnitas taco first. The pork was very tasty and crispy on some parts, just how I like it.

The Fish Tacos were lightly breaded and fried and very hot and fresh. The slaw was pretty good that was on it as well. 

The chips were warmed and you can get salsa by request. 

I would definitely go back here and I'm happy to find a fish taco that I like. I haven't really done a big fish taco exploration in SF, but I found this one and I like it.
author: Mack L.

description:
BEWARE! COCKROACHES LURKING IN RESTAURANT

Worst Mexican food ever!
1. Burrito (meat) tasted reminiscent to Alpo dog food. I barely took 3 bites and ended up dumping the food. Disgusting! Im sure the food was spoiled. 
2. Customer service was horrible! The two chubby women that work there had so much attitude
3. my bf and i saw some cockroaches after we started eating. they were hanging around food area. Im assuming theres a host of them since this was during the day and some decided to come out in the daylight. 

Take heed! You have been warned!
author: Annette F.

description:
Once in a while I find myself out this way with about an hour to kill, waiting for my boyfriend to make his periodic stop at the Ex's place. 

I'd rather eat a crappy taco than go with him.  

And the carne asade taco here is seriously crappy.  How you get zero flavor out of steak is beyond me. 

The carnitas taco though, not too bad.  Pretty darn good actually.  And they're generous with their meat portions.  The chips are ok, but the salsa is a disappointing little cup of diced tomatoes and cilantro.

Cramped seating, a mix of a stools/bar area and a couple wobbly tables lining the wall across from the grill.  

The two women I've only ever seen working there like to watch videos, or something anyway, on their phones.  A lot.   Maybe that's why they always forget my jalapenos.
author: Meg W.

description: The food here is quite good but the female cashiers are H O R R I B L E. Very poor attitude.
author: Calvin K.

description: Terrible Service And Terrible Food...Cash Register Lady Was Rude As Can Be...I Hope This Place Will Make Way For A Real Taqueria To Take It's Pace...What A Waste Of Money
author: Warren M.

description: I'm really sad. This has been a neighborhood favorite for awhile. I'm not sure what's going on but the last 3 times have been bad. My carnitas was loaded with fat, and I can't order another one. :(...my last 2 burritos had under cooked rice. I'm still giving 2 stars--for hope. That they come back to being great. Oh yea--they raised their prices to boot!!!!
author: M F.

description:
Not the best Mexican food around, but it does the trick. My burrito was a bit on the salty, watery side. Still decently tasty though.

On a sad note, I think my sister got a terrible bout of food poisoning here. Eek. That makes me afraid to come back.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Let's do some math: 

2 -- blocks away from my house
1 -- year of living two blocks away
365 -- opportunities to eat a burrito
15 -- likely times I ate a burrito in the last year
7 -- likely times I ate a burrito here. 
6 -- burritos I could have lived without.
1 -- burrito I really liked, the most recent. The shrimp burrito, with sour cream. 

An entire year passed of so-so burritos that were really just last ditch 10pm dinners after a long day of work where I didn't want to do anything for myself other than consider a selfie of my forearm with a forearm-sized burrito next to it, someone give me food, and eat it. 

This all adds up to ithe shrimp burrito that may have me coming back other than last ditch late dinners.
author: Jon A.

description:
I came here for lunch in a weds 

Ordered a regular grilled chicken burrito with extra salsa. It was pretty good but  some of the pieces of chicken were burnt. The salsa tasted really fresh which is good.

The cashier was nice. 

If I'm in the neighborhood again I would probably come back and try the carnitas or just a bean and cheese with extra salsa.
author: DOM d.

description: This place has been around forever, how does it keep going in a hipster good food, slow food, cool food world of sf? it sucks! Bland, stale, old, outdated, not authentic, yet not hip, yet not nada. COme on change the menu and ingredients and get yo stuff togehter.
author: SForiginal T.

description:
The mahi-mahi tacos with mango salsa are worth trying if you're at La Playa, but if you're able to - try to ask for more chunky salsa (the mango when mixed too much gets a little messy) or ask if you can put it all in a burrito instead.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This is my favorite burrito spot in SF! But sometimes they don't have carnitas and I am sad, it is their best meat. 
The service is always wonderful. They take phone orders so you can just run in a pick it up!
author: Max R.

description:
Okay, I've been coming to this place off and on for 4 years, strictly because of it's proximity to my house (I live a block away).  Honestly, I feel this place is only around because it's the only Mexican joint in its area.  You'd have to walk to Celia's about 5 blocks over for another spot...other than that, the closest is the Mission and/or Mission St by Crocker Amazon.

The food is decent, but it's inconsistent, not just in cooking, but in presentation.  I usually will order a fish taco plate....and on several occasions, it comes out in varying portion sizes, sometimes with beans and rice, sometimes without.  But I'm even to overlook that.

What compels me to write this review is the service.  The lady and the guy know my face..I live a block away and do almost everything on that block (laundry, haircut, vet, produce shopping, morning coffee, late night Korean/Soju binges)....yet, whenever I walk in there, the attitude is cold, almost condescending...I've had comments thrown at me when I ask them to deviate from their menu a bit (I once asked them to add a bit of carnitas to an order of Huevos Rancheros), like "You know, that will cost extra"....

yeah, dude...no sh*t...do I look like I can't afford your overpriced $2.00 for a side of 1/8 cup of carnitas to go with my eggs?

I dunno, maybe it's just me...i say go in and see for yourself.  You'll feel like a step child.

Hell, I can go to Park Chalet down the street and get 5 fish tacos and an ice cold beer for the price of one of your burritos.  And it's not even Mexican fare.

Maybe it's because they're the only Mexican joint in the immediate area that they feel they can act so entitled....but if you want a more authentic Mexican experience (food and service)...head to the Mission.
author: Mike E.

description: Not authentic. Not good. It's bland but ok I guess if you're in a rush. The service is not great. The staff almost seem to hate the place which is unlike other workers in the surrounding area like Devils Teeth or Toyose. They could use new management or workers that are a bit more enthused.
author: Reasonably H.

description:
The reason I'm giving the place 2 stars is due to the endless, loud talking between the  staff. 

In particular the woman who was working the register apparently has  not heard of using her "inside voice" and spent the entire time gossiping to the male worker in a voice loud enough to wake the dead. She spoke fast, in spanish, and just kept going on and on. 

The food itself was ok, but wear ear plugs if eating there. Personally, the food wasn't that good that it's worth going back.
author: Cathy S.

description: This place has the best breakfast burritos! Make sure you ask for their hot sauce! It's not too spicy but has an amazing flavor! Will be coming here again!
author: Natalie C.

description:
I really hate to give anything a bad review, but really if you mess up a burrito, you may just want to stop calling yourself a taqueria! 

I had the carne asada and shrimp burrito and I could not have been more devastated with it. Initially I looked at it and thought wow, its pretty big, not bad for $8 or so. About 1/4 of the way into the burrito and I had not reached any carne asada or shrimp. Didn't reach those two main ingredients until almost half of the thing was gone. The carne asada lacked flavor and tasted pretty awful actually. Have to admit, my fault for forgetting to tell them to hold off on the lettuce, nothing worse than biting into soggy lettuce to top it off. 

Yes, I am pretty picky when it comes to Mexican food, but I do take many factors into consideration when judging a restaurant, and I honestly have to say, I will not be returning nor recommending to anyone I know in the Sunset or SF.

Giving it 2 stars because maybe something else there is actually good, but the boyfriend had a wet burrito and didn't seem so satisfied either so 2 is the best I can do.
author: Alyssa A.

description:
The fish taco. The grilled mahi-mahi taco. Absolutely amazing!!!

The fish taco is breaded fried fish, guacamole, cabbage, so delicious. It is almost perfect, but on a few occasions the fish was over breaded. That said, I've had it a million times and the vast majority of times it was unbeatable.

The grilled mahi-mahi is topped with a mango pico de gallo that steals the show.

The tacos don't travel well, they are best enjoyed in the restaurant. Want to-go, get a burrito. I haven't had it, but the shrimp burrito seems to be pretty popular.
author: Jose P.

description:
Not the best taqueria I've ever been to. Their chips aren't that great, the prices are a little bit higher than most other taquerias, and the salsa is just average. The reason I keep coming back, though, is the Three Pepper Burrito with chicken. The roasted poblano peppers and super tender chicken are a match made in burrito heaven. The total for one of these burritos comes out to around $8, which isn't that bad.

If you are a fan of Chipotle's chicken, I would try Le Playa's chicken. You might be a convert.
author: Gun-Ik P.

description:
Next to Chinese Food, Mexican food, or rather.. taqueria-style Mexican food is probably my favorite take-out cuisine for me.

Why does this place rank higher than the rest?
1) MORE MEAT - plenty of it in my tacos, burritos, quesadillas!  No skimpin!

2) TASTES BETTER!! - Where applicable (Carne Asada, Pollo Asada) Meats are cooked fully on the grill and have plenty of that grill flavor!
You can also specify black beans too, as I usually do.. 

3) Tasty favorites/regulars I order up:  The following menu items have happily earned a regular spot in my tummy:  Carne Asada & Shrimp Burrito, Any Quesadilla, Any Taco (esp. carnitas), and the occasional fish taco and torta fit the bill.  

I've tried other taqueria places out here, but their offerings just seemed watery, tasteless, or just average.

Caveats:  OK, first impressions from the street, La Playa TQ doesn't look all that impressive, especially being situated next to a very dive-y looking run down surfer coffee shop, but they still scored a very high 98 on the SF Dept of Health Inspections.

So, when it comes to the Sunset, La Playa ranks at the top for me in terms of flavor and ingredients when it comes to the wonderful burritos, tacos and quesadillas that they offer.
author: Harry W.

description:
I've been coming here off and on since I moved to the Outer Sunset, about eight years ago. This place has always been hit or miss(more miss than anything). It just happens to be one of couple of bad Mexican  restaurants in this neighborhood....I usually drive out all the way out to the Excelsior/Outer Mission or even SSF for some decent Mexican food. 

 The reason for my review today is for one of those big "MISS" situations. I ordered a chicken & shrimp Super Burrito to go, the shrimp was overcooked beyond belief. Also the smallest Super Burrito I've ever see, as soon as I bit off the end and looked at it almost a quarter of it was tortilla and forgot my refried beans that I asked. Was I suppost to pay nearly $8.00 for an wrong, overcooked burrito,  I don't think so.  Keep in mind I ordered the same thing last week to go and it was perfect by the time I got here, that's the only reason I came back! I only live four blocks away.

We went back and showed the women who takes the orders that the burrito was all kinds of bad and told her we wanted our money back. She said no, please let me have it corrected. She took it over to the cook, yelled at him, then stood there and made sure he made it the right. She was awesome!


The quality control at this place is absurd!!! It must be the lack of a latin community in the neighborhood that let's these Mexican restaurants get away with selling such bad interpretations of Mexican food.....
author: Nick V.

description: We get take-out here at least once a week.  The food is good and the prices are fair!  I love anything with the "chipotle sauce" on it!  All the shrimp items are great and I have recently discovered how delicious the chile relleno is...on a platter or in a burrito! We have had just about everything on the menu and can't complain about any of it!
author: Katie N.

description:
Located on the ocean-side of the city, cool salt winds whistling up to its door, La Playa Taqueria makes what are doubtlessly the finest burritos in the Outer Sunset District.

Adequately grilled tortillas hide outstanding meats, perfectly melted cheese, and a hellacious spice bound to leave the most seasoned veteran of the burrito battlefields of San Francisco begging for mercy. The food is always hot, and while the spanish rice can be less then al dente, the delightful refired beans more then make up for it. 

Love garlic? Go for the amply sized three pepper (or if you add Jalapenos, four pepper) burrito, which perfectly melds poblano, green and red peppers, along with some sautéed long cut onions and half an avocado. With their superb Carne Asada, it may be one of the most remarkably tasty burritos in The City.
