Credit Cards accepted, fresh chips (you can often see them frying in back) available, seating is minimal, and service is usually with what passes for a smile in the Outside Lands.
author: Casey U.

description:
Aight let me just tell you whats up: three pepper burrito. Delicious. Don't f*ck around with the stuff on the menu thats wack (breakfast burrito and other random American-Mex food, although this place technically makes American-Mex, but moving on). Matter of fact, to all the uppity yups on here that are all "they don't make a breakfast burrito like I'm used to at the pretentious little organic deli", I have two remarks: one, what is the appeal of a breakfast burrito? The very idea is disgusting! Scrambled eggs in a burrito?!?! What are you thinking? And where do you think that came from? Some hellish kitchen in a bizarre state like Arizona or Florida no doubt. Anyway. 

Second: to those who note that "the girl at the counter was rude", you think the world revolves around you? Grow up and get a life. Better yet, move away from San Francisco! You're perfect for somewhere. Why don't you live above a shopping mall? PF Changs and Chipotle will be right next door. 

Ok, back to La Playa and the delicious three pepper burrito. They do it right, stuffed full with everything that's supposed to go in a burrito, the burritos are huge, and you can get several tasty salsas (just ask!). They are also reasonably priced. The girl at the counter can definitely be a little short but don't walk away until you get your salsa and your pico. Just be patient, it will be worth it.  

Four stars because the fish taco was nothing to write home about. In fact, it was kind of bad. But it had a tasty sauce in it, the fish was just cooked in a weird not good way. Know this and don't be tempted. Yes, fish tacos are delicious, but this is not the place.  

Final comment: the burrito really is fantastic! I've eaten California-Mex style burritos from Los Angeles to the Central Valley to San Francisco and La Playa gets high marks.
author: Michael M.

description: Definitely a good spot to get Mexican food in Outer Sunset rather than having to go all the way out to the Mission. I've had their carne asada super burrito and their wet surf burrito with no complaints!
author: Jeff L.

description: We have been purchasing take out here for many years and didn't have any problems.  However, recently over the last year or so we have had trouble placing our take out orders.  Several times nobody answered their phone and we often called back with still no answer.  We had no idea if they closed the shop or just didn't bother picking up the phone.  We then ate elsewhere or just cooked at home.  I understand that an order can be placed online but I refuse to take the time to go online to place an order not knowing when it will be ready.  They should at least pick up the phone and say "Can you wait..I will get right back"..but no, just nothing.  Also the ladies at the counter have never been friendly.  If they want to stay in business they should try to care about their customers that support them.  The food has usually been satisfactory but we do not plan to patronize this restaurant any more.  I hope that they will change their ways in the future or that somebody else will take it over or another Mexican take out restaurant will open in the area.
author: Patrick S.

description: I was born and raised in the mission district here in the city so Mexican food is life basically. Once in a while though, I will enjoy a gringo style California burrito because let's face it- FRIES ARE DELICIOUS. I decided to try la playa taqueria since I've recently had to say bye to my mama's house and find my own place here in the outbound sunset. It's alright. I was expecting a bigger portion for almost $10. Salsa is not authentic. Taste like the jar from the grocery store. My California burrito was decent. I did get free chips since I had to wait a little longer. Might be back If I was kinda desperate. Nothing like the taquerias I grew up with though. Change your salsa please. It makes me wana cry.
author: Marian B.

description:
items I've tried

Super Carne Asada burrito
Carne Asada tacos
Chicken tacos
Mahi tacos
Supreme beef nachos

Everything was delish except for the carne asada. It was flavorless.
author: Jo S.

description:
It was empty when I showed up early in the morning but it was nice inside and clean.
The breakfast burritos are not the best. They're not terrible, but Ive had better for sure. The guac tasted funny, and those ortega peppers were way overcooked and kept in vinegar. That didn't go with the eggs at all. It's not cheap either!
author: Otto V.

description:
Outstanding fish tacos and the carnitas was very tasty. I asked for jalapenos on my burrito and they were generous with those. You do have to ask for hot sauce, but it wasn't a problem. 

I often come to the area to walk on the beach, now I have a great place to stop for excellent Mexican. Thanks Yelpers for the great recommendation!
author: John K.

description:
Every once in a while, when I have a craving for burrito, I'll stop at this taqueria near Ocean Beach. My recommendation is the carne asada super burrito, although I can't comment on too many the other items on the menu. Just make sure that they don't cheat you on the meat, as they have a tendency to stuff it with beans.

Overall I'd say that it's an okay place, if you're really craving a burrito and you're nowhere near the Mission district.
author: Anthony Z.

description: Extremely rude employees, unhappy and unfriendly. Her face is literally evil. Food is mediocre. DONT GO HERE
author: Sam F.

description: Food is not bad as it's the only one in the neighborhood. I had a large order for our family and my burrito was forgotten. So I had to drive back and they were closing. I was bummed be u asked if everything was in the bags.
author: Minna M.

description: This place does all of the Mexican basics really well! As others have noted in here there is woman who works the register though who is stunningly rude. She will treat you like she resents you for bringing her business.
author: Brian K.

description:
I have no idea why this place doesn't have 5 stars. Its fantastic. The service is great, and the staff is super friendly. The fish tacos are to die for. I tend to order two everytime I'm here even if I already have more than enough food. I just can't resist. 

The burritos are great too. Pretty standard, stuffed with toppings, and delicious. Nachos are a good choice as well. Basically you can't go wrong here. 

They have breakfast food as well, but I haven't had the chance to try it yet. Definitely recommend stopping by here if you're in the area.
author: Lauren D.

description: I live right by this place and have tried really hard to like it but I've actually started getting rotten food from them. On 2 occasions I have received rotten beans. The people working there are nice but they need to work on the quality of their food.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Poor customer service. Did not have carnitas or salmon for tacos, only catfish. I opted for shrimp tacos which tasted like ammonia and dirt. Otherwise, the food was so bland.
author: Kimberly W.

description: I haven't been here in almost 5 years till today.  My favorite burrito, the holy grail of burritos use to be this places shrimp burrito. ...not anymore. They've totally watered down the Chipotle sauce :( my burrito was about as bland as a bowl of white rice.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Wish I could give no stars. Lady behind the register on 3/23/14 at 7:00pm treats you like a dumb ass and is pretty rude.  Good is ok. But not good enough to get shitty service.
author: Rob W.

description: god, I should not have tried this place a second time.  My partner called in a take out order, Shrimp and Steak Burrito.  Upon arrival, the place has no customers, 530pm, not a good sign.  A lady is frying chips and other lady is making the burrito I ordered.  There are no other orders in sight.  I told her I was there for the Steak and Shrimp burrito.  The lady ask what my name was and I said the order is under Rey or Sunny.  Then she asked if a lady called it in and I said yes.  This place has to be the most worst customer service and unfriendly workers at any establishment.  Paid, placed a 30 cent tip in the jar.  Get home, NO SHRIMP in the burrito.  The chips tasted stale and oily. This place is a fraud.
author: Rey D.

description:
I wish I could love this place. It's close to my apt, and there aren't a lot of burrito options here in the Outer Sunset.  

However, the chips aren't good,  the beans are dry, and they always get my order wrong.
author: Jacquelene S.

description:
Three out of five?  How?!

I really, really, really wanted to like this place.  As anyone who is familiar with the Sunset knows there aren't any taquerias in the area.  So I had high hopes that La Playa Taqueria would be the place to get half decent tacos without having to drive out to the Mission.  I was sorely disappointed by my trip here.

Let me start by saying that at over two dollars for a taco (just under five for two), is a bit on the pricier side in terms of tacos.  The meat choices are very limited: carne asada, carnitas, and chicken.  Even Chipotle offers more variation!  But with so few meat choices, each one must be fine tuned, right?  At a glance, I already had a sinking feeling in my stomach that this was going to be less than delicious.

I should have just followed my instincts and left.  However, my stomach ended up ordering three carne asada and three carnitas (to split with my SO).  The total, with a Jarritos came out to $17.94.  We were not given chips or salsa to start (these came to our table later) and they didn't even offer to open our drink!  Our food was ready in less than 10 minutes which was great but it was not served with lime (as EVERY taqueria does).  Fine, get up and ask.

I take a look at my plate and these tacos are just overstuffed.  The cilantro and onions were roughly chopped and just thrown atop the taco in a mess.  The salsa was splattered on top in chunks.  Note that this isn't a hot sauce but a mild, bland veggie puree.  Since they used a medium sized tortilla and they are served side-by-side, each taco became soggy due to the steam coming off of the one next to it.  These tacos had no structure and turned into a floppy mess.

I start off with the carne asada taco.  It was difficult to eat due to the soggy, messy factors but on top of that the meat wasn't good.  It felt like shredded meat, whereas carne asada is supposed to be small chunks of meat.  The favor was unlike any other carne asada I have ever had.  It amazed me that they somehow managed to achieve the flavor of peppered beef jerky!

The carnitas was closer to flavor to any other carnitas taco I've ever had.  However, it was super fatty.  It was the fattiest pork I've ever had in tacos.  Some of the meat was crispy while others just fell apart in your mouth.  Inconsistent at best.

Not even worth the convenience factor.  I would much rather drive down to SSF or into the Mission for tacos.  Probably spend less on gas than I will here for subpar food.
author: Sandy C.

description: My neighborhood taqueria (besides Gordos). Love this place for take out and you can typically find parking (PLUS!). Not much space for dine-in, which is a shame. I typically order the shrimp burrito, delicious. Cheap, good eats. Enjoy.
author: Jen D.

description:
Born and raised in southern California very close to the Mexican border, I take the food that comes from our lovely neighbors to the south very seriously. When I moved to San Francisco, I was nervous I would have a hard time finding a cheap, delicious local spot close to my place, but have no fear--La Playa Taqueria is here!

The staff has always been very friendly to me and has been very quick getting my order together. My personal favorite is the Chile Relleno burrito, but their nachos and tacos are also delicious, thus far, I believe they can do no wrong. If I am in a hurry, I will call my order ahead of time and by the time I walk over, it's ready to go.

 If you're in the Outer Sunset and have a hankering for yummy Mexican food, La Playa Taqueria is where it's at.
author: Timorei A.

description:
I get burritos from here whenever I go to my dentist's. They have decent burritos for reasonable prices! The only complaint i have was the chorizo breakfast burrito wasn't that great (overly salty IMO). Service is quick! 

Definitely give them a try when you're in the neighborhood or going to the beach! The 71 runs right along on Noriega.
author: Cynthia Y.

description: Burritos aren't what they use to be. Went in for lunch today, ordered a steak n shrimp burrito, no guacamole and no lettuce. Tell me why my burrito is soggy? The beef had a boiled taste instead of asada "grilled" that messed up the burrito for me. Point is who wants a hot soggy burrito for lunch??? I don't, I won't be returning.
author: Selene P.

description: This place is a nice little spot hidden out by the beach. The Chile Relleno Burrito is absolutely amazing, but rich. The place is small, but for a taqueria that size, the food and atmosphere is cozy and traditional. The service was okay, but could have been better. There were two cooks, which was fine, but only one person working at the counter. While they were nice, the service was slow and an additional person to take orders and/or answer the phone would have helped the over all efficiency of the restaurant. Overall the food was good and while the location is out of the way, it's a great place if you're already in that part of the city.
author: Kevin E.

description:
usually get the fish tacos  but tried the Carnitas and carne Asada tacos. Both are good and would come back again. The meat is over flowing in your taco.  

their green salsa with avocado is good here.  I would recommend  to eat  there because take out with leave the corn tortilla very soft .

Nachos are a must as well, chips are still crunchy at the bottom after all the great toppings have been put on them
author: Michael T.

description:
La Playa Taqueria is a small business close to the beach on Noriega. The burritos and platters don't stand out so I can give this place a 3 - 3.5 stars. This Taqueria is a place I try if I'm doing laundry around the area, otherwise I don't really go out of my way to eat here. Their food is seasoned decently, and I don't find myself dousing their food with hot sauce to mask the taste.

Steak and Shrimp Burrito - This is one of the few places I can get a steak and shrimp burrito that is quite delicious sometimes.  However, there was one incident I didn't feel too good eating my burrito and found refuge in the bathroom.

Nachos - Carne Asada on top of load bearing chips with refried beans and etc haven't disappointed me yet. Of course, this should be eaten as soon as it reaches your hands.

A fairly average Taqueria that is convenient to small business and homes that are located nearby. However, I aim to try this place again for the breakfast menu and will update when that occurs.
author: Casey L.

description: Terrible! First off they do not even have carnitas or pork available at all. $9 for a burrito with no chips n salsa. Pigeons were walking around inside the restaurant. Food was mediocre at best. Worst Mexican restaurant in all of SF.
author: Parker P.

description: Get the steak super burrito. One of the best burritos I've ever had. I wouldn't think twice about driving all the way to the city just for this burrito. Only downside, the staff isn't very friendly and there is no sense of urgency.
author: Allison M.

description: This place is convenient and close to home so when i have literally no choices of food to eat at home, i would be here. Very warm inside too. I always order the super burrito because its pretty good. WAY TOO EXPENSIVE THOUGH.  $7.54 for one?  Chipotle is probably puts more filling in their burrito's but still, La Playa tastes pretty good to me.  There fish and shrimp taco's are good too, except they gave me a small stomach ache.  Another problem i have though is the cashier lady always gives me that look on my face.
author: Reginald W.

description: I live down the street and go here quite often , I absolutely looove the shrimp super burritos. The workers are super friendly just at times don't fully understand orders being placed but overall great place to get you're Mexican food fix !!!
author: Ashley S.

description: Maybe because it's cheap. Maybe because it's close. But I keep coming back to this place. It may not be the best Mexican food in the city, but it's good Mexican food, and it gets the job done.
author: Ryan S.

description: My first visit i have one of their b-fast burritos....its was OK, but will try a different one on the next B-fast visit. Second visit was for lunch and i have a carne asada & shrimp burrito and was barely ok. Maybe will go for regualr burrito next time. The tastiest was their homemade papas and salsa. Hopefully next time I come I will be able to write something that gives good reviews about the food..but so far gotta say just barely a OK tasting place.
author: Jaime P.

description:
Pricy, but portion and taste are excellent!
The waiting time is a bit long, dont have a dedicated waiting area, other than those everything else is fine.
author: Thomas L.

description: I have ordered food from this taqueria at least half a dozen times and they almost always get my order wrong! They put in the wrong kind of beans, guacamole when I said no guac, etc. A couple years ago, the service was much better and the food was of higher quality, but now it does not live up to the standard I expect from a public service establishment!
author: Sophia J.

description: Ill give this place two stars because the staff were quick and friendly. Although I had a carnitas super burrito which was one of the worst I had in a long time. Pork is all fat and a bone inside it. What a nice surprise! Pork taste like it has been boiled and lack any taste. Chips are stale and I notice they microwave the food. If youre stuck in the outer sunset and this is your only place to grab mexican, I feel for you...
author: Shawn W.

description: Not bad. I like the Super Nachos, Super Burritos, and their Fish Tacos with mangos. Large portions and tasty. The staff is friendly, too.
author: James M.

description: Since I live by here, when my mom and I feel lazy to cook, we take their burritos to go. I just love their steak and shrimp burrito but the only problem I really got with it is that it's meat is way too overcooked(literally burnt). Other than that pretty good food and pretty good service.
author: Ada H.

description: This place is a complete mess from beginning to end. Their credit card machine takes 5mns to process anything then you have no idea when they call your order. They just whatever is ready and since everyone orders the same it's complete chaos. When after waiting for 20mns they look at you and ask you what you want, you politely ask if the last order they called was yours they pretty much rudely lecture you for not understanding. I had 2 burritos (Super & Steak & Shrimp). Did not cross their mind to write on the foil which was which. No salsa or anything in my bag. The worst service ever. I will go back to Burrito Express instead where they actually treat people respectfully. The only reason I give it 2 stars and not one is that the food tasted decent and I enjoyed it (once I forgot the horrible treatment I received). Not going back,
author: Jean-Francois R.

description: I live a few blocks from this taqueria and buy the chile relleno burritos from time to time.  The service is not friendly. I'm not saying they're rude, or I would've stopped going a long time ago. I'm just saying it wouldn't hurt for the cashier to be a little more personable. The food itself varies except for the chile relleno burritos which are consistently flavorful. The other choices can be soggy, like the tostadas; or dry, as in the case of the chicken burritos.  Also, they try to jip me on chips. Tonight for example, I bought three chicken burritos and one supreme beef burrito but they only gave me three bags of chips. I'll keep going to this place only because it's convenient but I sure hope they realize that their food and service can be improved.
author: Angie A.

description: Great food! I suggest getting the Fish Tacos Baja Style (my absolute favorite). I have had multiple things from the menu, including the Chili Relleno burrito and " " " plate. I was quite pleased with the burrito, but give the Chili Relleno Plate a satisfactory on quality. The cheese inside the chili relleno was not fully melted and needed to go into the microwave (at the taqueria), not once, but TWICE! Although I was dissatisfied with this entree, it still did not stop me from ordering food in the future. The service is friendly, the parking outside is very convenient (with no meters), and they have awesome homemade chipotle sauce (44 cents for extra sauce). Also, their pico de gallo is fresh and tasty! This is my to-go-to taqueria for a quick, tasty bite to eat!
author: Priscilla D.

description:
Veggie Burrito Fish Tacos and Carne asada Taco pretty amazing I think its like $2.50/taco but well worth it they stack em up pretty high! Hits the spot after a surf!

It took a while for them to warm up to us, so don't get offended its just their culture you have to give them time and then you will gain their trust
author: LJ E.

description: breakfast burritos were not great and the wait was kinda long. took about 15 minutes to get the burritos. when we finally got our food, the rice and potatoes were undercooked!!!!  15 minutes for poor food?  this place used to be really good.  maybe it was an off day? or maybe im spoiled by expresso burrito and gordo burrito...hopefully next time will be better.
author: Will P.

description: Repeated my order several times on the phone and even had if repeated back to me, and only one burrito out of 3 was correct. Not sure if I'll be back again.
author: Chantal J.

description:
Came to La Playa (or as my friend calls it, The Player's Club) for dinner last week. I really wanted Chipotle but La Playa was conveniently close-by and I didn't want to make the 15 minute drive to Daly City. Ordered the chicken super burrito and it quenched my hunger (Can you quench hunger? Or can thirst only be quenched? Oh well). The burrito had a creamy sauce that was unexpected from a burrito. I'm thinking it was the combination of the refried beans + guac + sour cream all mixing together, but I couldn't figure it out.

My tummy gives La Playa Taqueria...3 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description:
Let's see what's good here?

Chicken Torta:  Toasted bread and moist , great seasoned chicken meat, fair price and friendly service = five stars in my book.
author: S C.

description: Not too many taquerias here in the outer sunset area but La Playa taqueria is definitely the real deal. Their steak and shrimp burrito is out of this world. Large juicy shrimps piled on top of delicious steak. Yum! Their tacos are pretty bombs too. If you're in the area and craving some Mexican, drop on by. Prices are average - right around $10 for a burrito and a drink.
author: Andy T.

description: Gross. Don't waste your time. Just don't eat here so it'll go out of business and something good can go in there.
author: Johnson M.

description:
Here's a great lunch for a foggy Sunset day:
-Fish taco
-Diet Coke
-Comes with a few chips

Total: $4.12
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
OK burrito place for the sunset.

Fast and friendly service.  will need to try it again and other menus to see how it fares to other taquerias.

We had the veggie burrito, carnitas, and fish taco this time...


Decent price, size, and flavor.  Will try their wet burritos next time and update reviews.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: The food is average, which is why I would give it three stars.  However, the service is pretty terrible.  I asked for hot sauce in my burrito, but the lady said they don't offer that.  Hmm, it doesn't seem to difficult or costly, and all of the other taquerias do it.  But ok then, could I please get some jalapenos inside?  Jalapenos cost extra, sixty cents, she says.  Well that seems ridiculous, but I said ok, because I really wanted my burrito spicy.  Well it turns out they put about five little slices of jalapeno in there.  Nickel and diming your customers is not a good way to get repeat business.  Better off driving down to El Burrito Express on Taraval.
author: Alfredo I.

description:
you had me at fish-taco
and then you gave me mango
un poco sunset gusto
ole, la playa
author: Lloyd M.

description:
This is one of the best taquerias I have been to! I ordered the super burrito, and it was really good! You also get chips and salsa!

The prices here are also affordable! I would rather eat here than at a chipotle! 

All in all, I love this place and it's food! The customer service is hospitable!
author: Katrina A.

description: Good prompt service. Not great for dining in but they offer 10% off beer at the liquor store next door if you show your receipt! Burritos are great enchiladas were a little too dry for my liking but its convenient and close to me so I will definitely come back. Carne asada is always good from the tacos to the nachos it's yummy!
author: Kayleen R.

description: Can't really recommend the place. Stopped in earlier, ordered a pork super burrito, when it was done, they told me my pork burrito was ready. Imagine my surprise when I got home and bit into a shrimp burrito (and have felt a little ill since eating the small portion I did).
author: Casey B.

description:
Almost gave them a 4 but that was because of the crap experience at El Beach "No" Burrito earlier in the day.  I wrote a review about that trip.

After not having my taco hunger quenched and confirming no non-taco food item would satisfy I headed out to La Playa Taqueria.

The tacos were fairly cheap, tasty and plentiful.  And (or should that be AND) it took less time for me to go from outside to sitting at a table with taco in hand than I wasted waiting to be served at that other place.

While it is no "El Gran Taco Loco", the tacos were good.  My pollo was a little dry and the taco's themselves were a little wet and sloppy.  But not to bad.

The salsa(or whatever they call it there) was a disappointment.  Essentially diced tomato(fresh) and a little cilantro(very little).

They have some fish taco's and a few different burritos I think I'll be trying.

Not great but for Sunset I was pretty pleased.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description: Staff is incredibly rude. Ask them to put the spit on the side because they don't know better.
author: Lorelei C.

description:
3.5  stars

La Playa Taqueria is definitely a great alternative from Mission. If you are craving for a burrito, taco or anything and is too lazy to drive all the way to Mission. Eat at La Playa instead. The prices are a little bit higher than Mission but considering the gas and time, its about the same at the end. Friendly & quick service. I ordered the chicken quesadilla ($5.35) which comes with salsa, guacamole & sour cream on the safe. The chicken was perfectly grilled and the cheese was just enough and didn't overpower the whole quesadilla. My bf had the taco platter which came with two tacos of your choice, rice & beans. The mahi mahi taco with mango salsa was really good but im biased because i like fish and mango's!
author: Carol Y.

description:
I've only tried the 3 pepper burrito with Chicken, and the Shrimp & Steak burrito.. This place is not bad for a quick weekend fix of burritos if you can't find any good place.

The chicken tasted re-cooked... The Shrimp and Steak was too salty for me the first time I had it. However, I think the food is decent. This place is average, in my books.

Update: 4 years later, I am still coming here. The shrimp and fish tacos are god tier. The breakfast burritos are also really good and come in huge portions. I am upgrading the review to 5 stars.
author: Sherman H.

description:
I am so glad I found this place.  Since moving to the outer sunset/parkside area, I've been really frustrated with the taqueria's in this area.  
This burrito place is the best in the outer sunset.  Anything with the  pollo rojo is great!  Service is fast.  Location is convenient.
author: Elena L.

description:
Best Taqueria this side of Twin Peaks. It won't drive the places in the Mission out of business but, decent food, big portions and pretty cheap. 

Be sure to ask if you want something a little different then they have it on the menu. I found they'll grill the tortillas instead of steaming them if you ask. Makes a world of difference to me anyway.

Same with their breakfasts. They'll mix and match a bit there too. Even had bacon for me one time even though its not on the menu at all.
author: Peter S.

description: fish tacos were excellent. the beef and chicken were nicely flavored and not fatty as I have had in many a mission taqueria.  My favorite - the 3 pepper burrito....
author: Imran M.

description:
Filling... Check.
Greasy... Check.
Delicious.... Check.

Not the best breakfast burritos I've had but they were still very good. My fiancee and I shared the Chorizo and the Mexican Breakfast Burritos and both were very good in different ways.

The chorizo burrito is self-explanatory. Greasy and salty with just a bit of spice they did a great job of balancing the amount of chorizo in the burrito in relation to the eggs, sauce and cheese. It wasn't too overpowering but it was definitely in your face with flavor.

The Mexican burrito was a lot "lighter", as far as breakfast burritos go. Ground beef with fresh pico de gallo, eggs and cheese I really enjoyed it because the pico was really fresh tasting and provided a far less greasy alternative to the chorizo burrito. The meat wasn't overpowered with too much season, it all just combined together well.

My friends ordered the bacon burrito and I recommend just skipping that one. Too dry, not enough happening there.

Still, the two that we ordered were definitely good and they hit the spot before we had to head to the airport for our flight home.

Cheers!
author: Andrew B.

description:
I originally went here a few months ago and was not impressed.  The burrito was a little above average, but nothing to write home about.
However, I went back again because I did not feel like driving all the way to the Mission for my favorite burrito place, and tried something new.
Fellow Yelpers, I have discovered my new second favorite burrito place.
On my girlfriend's advice, I tried the 3 Pepper Burrito.  Absolutely fantastic.  I had to contain myself into not going back and getting another one.  It was that good.
The only thing is that I could have gone for some more spice.  I love spicy food and this is a little lacking.  Some more salsa for take home would be great.  Other than that, this place is great.
author: Shawn B.

description:
Nachos are perfect!!!  Chips are strong and tasty. Good weight bearing chips. Good mix of carnitas, sour cream, beans and everything.

Burrito was aslo quality. Large in size. Everything mixed well and the prices are reasonable.  

Not to forget that they have Mexican soda. Nice!!!
author: Raul V.

description:
By far the best chicken burrito I've ever had - The Three Pepper Burrito with your choice of grilled chicken or steak, roasted green, red, and poblano peppers, onions, garlic, rice, beans, cheese, avocado, salsa. 

The grilled taste of the chicken and peppers really does the trick! A great amount of avocado, meat, peppers... it just is well-built burrito. 

Before this amazing creation... I wasn't a fan of La Playa. I thought the fish tacos were mediocre. The guacamole it came with was lackluster. The salsa was bland. The chips were ok. And they don't make fish burritos though they have fish for tacos. I gave them many chances hoping I'd get a great fish taco... but it just didn't do it for me. I always opted for something else when Ryry wanted a burrito (he loved this place from the get-go).

One day I was feeling courageous and brave and decided to go all in and get a burrito with all the fixings... and boy was I happy and surprised! Now I never hesitate to go to La Playa for a delicious, filling, reasonable meal (half now, half for lunch tomorrow!)! yum... :D
author: Christine C.

description:
On one hand:

The nina breakfast was anything but, perhaps the most generous serving of eggs, black beans (free swap for chorizo) and roasted potatoes for less than $4 I've ever had. And the chicken in red sauce was almost all white meat, expertly packed into a spinach tortilla with more black beans and mild salsa. Rocking.

On the other hand:

Egg whites weren't an option and I wasn't too happy with the one bone I found in my chicken.

Verdict:

One hand is clearly favored over the other. I'm a fan!
author: Jason B.

description:
I had a vegetarian three pepper burrito. It was good, but nothing that special. I would probably go there again if I was at the beach, but not for any other reason.

The staff seemed completely zombified. Normally that would be pretty awesome, but these are the most boring zombies I've ever encountered. They didn't even make the slightest attempt to eat my brain. I was extremely disappointed.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Just had a burrito and it was fine.  The two stars are because the overhead lights (small glass canister-type, very pretty) are filthy.  The shame is that they hang not only over the dining area, but the cooking area.  Creepy, because they are really, really dusty.

I would go back for the food, but if you're a clean freak, you would have a problem with the dirty lights.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
When your tummy is a rumbling and you can't decide on whether you want Chinese or Korean, Korean or Chinese, just go to the only Mexican place in this hood. 

It seems that, other than the pizza place, one block up, you're going to be limited to Asian fare.
 
On our first visit, my crazy old man said "if we walk in here, and there aren't any Mexicans cooking, I'm leaving".  Well, lucky for him, he got to eat that day. 

It isn't the best, but it ain't the worst either.  Their chicken super burrito was just okay, but their shrimp burrito made up for my last visit there (much more shrimp factor than I anticipated).  I do wish they weren't so skimpy on their salsa. And, I wish there was another option besides pico de gallo, or hot sauce.  

I'm going to brush up on my Spanish (that's what happen to us half-breeds with bi-lingual parents who spoke different languages, so I didn't get to become tri-lingual) for my next visit and see if I can't order up some of the good salsa (I know they have some lingering somewhere) along with a Bret Michaels Trop-A-Rocka Snapple.  
I'm kicking myself for not grabbing one while I had the chance. ¿Alguien sabe donde puedo encontrar que Bret Michaels jugo? Por favor?
author: Kara B.

description:
This service is horrible at this place.  I only go because it is close to my house and everytime I go there I tell myself it will be the last.....this time it is.

The girl who works the cash register is very RUDE.  No smile, no "Hi, can take your order.....what can I get for you?", instead she just stares at you like you are an idiot until you talk....very akward and rude.  Plus, she never says thank you...which every restaurant should.  She is the type of person who will roll her eyes at a patron.

Ok...the food....

It is never consistent, there have been a few occasions when it has been pretty decent.  However, last time I ordered a chicken burrito and I almost threw up....the chicken was boiled....no seasoning, absolutely digusting.  One time I ordered a chicken burrito and they put chicken AND steak in it....probably because the stupid girl at the counter wasn't listening.  

I will not give them my business anymore, even though they are two blocks from my house.

They are RUDE and use CHEAP Ingredients.

I hope the girl at the counter reads this too!!!! Yeah that's right I'm talking to you!

I'll take the 10 minute drive to go to Mission and Onondaga to Guadalajara.
author: Sheila S.

description:
When I'm usually in the area, this is my go to fixing for a burrito. I usually only get the chicken supreme. It's the only place that I know which offers the white sauce chicken that I like, other joints usually served the red sauce or simply grilled chicken. 

The burritos are fairly priced, but on average from what I've seen a bit smaller/skinnier than competitors. Like I mentioned, I'd only come by if I'm in the area. 

There was a couple times where I order no salsa/onions and they didn't get it, which ruined my food, but their usually consistent with food alterations.
author: Austin N.

description:
I really disliked this place for a few reasons. One was because they had no salsa bar and two because it took forever for them to make my burrito. 

However, there was nothing wrong with my carnitas burrito. Not the best, not the worst. Also, I appreciate the fact that the chef took my request for spicy seriously. Being a white girl, few actually believe I can take it past the gringo level of spicy. I really like when people can tell I am not messing around when I say HOT! 

The pico de gallo could use some work and so can the freshness of their chips but overall this place is a good option for Mexican in an area where there are few options for anything that isn't some sort of Asian food. I  have also tried their fish and prawn taco's here and they are pretty good too.
author: Krista N.

description: Typically, when you've gone past your regular lunch hour and are starving, everything tastes delicious. Unfortunately, that couldn't even help them. This place blows... Hard.
author: MJ T.

description: The breakfast burrito with chorizo is filling and flavorful. But they always raise the price on me when I find something delicious on the menu. I guess it's still worth it compared to a regular burrito.
author: Allyson L.

description: I love this place. Especially the breakfast burritos. The neighborhood is great, i park right out front, have my burrito in minutes, and since it's so huge, I eat from several times over the course of the day...
author: Dalyn B.

description:
The hallmark of a great burrito is consistency. Every bite should be balanced, all the way to the juicy nub.

If you are in the sunset and want a great burrito, this is it.

I've tried the pork, shrimp, and beef burritos. The pork and shrimp are good, but the beef stands out.
author: Christopher B.

description: Ordered the 3 cheese enchilada. I'll rate that 4 out of 5 but the sides (beans and rice) were way too hard and under cooked. Service was from a guy that didn't care so you get the point. That's fine, no tip and not going back anyways.
author: Loreen L.

description:
I can haz nacho?
I venture to La Playa
Hoping things have changed
_____

I've given La Playa so many chances, but it continues to disappoint every time.  The other day I had a craving for nachos and I was too lazy to drive somewhere to fulfill that craving, so I walked over to La Playa, which is the only taqueria in this part of town.  I ordered nachos, paid extra for chicken, and proceeded to eat it all while still very much craving nachos and feeling sad and disappointed about the $8.50 that could've been spent on better, craving-satisfying nachos.

My sister got massive food poisoning on her first visit to La Playa years ago (though that was probably from the shrimp in her shrimp burrito), and I should've learned my lesson then.  Shame on me, and shame on La Playa.  Do yourself a favor and drive somewhere decent.
author: Jin D.

description: I went here a couple of weeks ago, and I do not remember what the food was like. That tells me it was okay, but not great. I'm pretty sure I got the veggie burrito, which seemed like it was a pretty good portion size for the price. The woman at the counter was also super friendly.
author: Amanda P.

description: This place makes a solid super chicken burrito, and is in the neighborhood - both good things.  The burritos to go are super-quick.  I do wish they had more salsa options, and maybe a salsa bar so you can get as much as is needed.
author: Zac W.

description: I give it five stars mostly because of their three pepper pollo burrito. It's like God came down and said "let there be three peppers, and let there be some goddamn good meat too." Also, it gets five stars because it's in the Sunset, which is severely lacking of good Mexican food. They sometimes have a special fish burrito that is excellent beyond belief. I miss La Playa. God bless 'em.
author: Paul O.

description: Might be a wait for burritos they charge for salsa. They food is good though. May be limited space inside so I recommend take out for this place.
author: Alex C.

description:
Ok, so the tacos were alright. Fish was crispy and tasty without being greasy. Chicken was pretty good, rice was par for the course. Then I went for the beans.

This place had without a doubt the worst refried beans I have ever seen or tasted in my life. They were rather white and creamy looking. It seemed like someone had taken real refried beans, combined it with water and lard, and then stewed it for a bit. Beans aside this place is OK.

But to me beans make the meal so I have to go negative.
author: Alex O.

description: This place is great.  LOVE their super veggie burrito.  I don't want to know the calorie content because if I did, I wouldn't be getting them as often as I do.  Super good and very filling.  Really big enough for 2 meals.  It also comes with a size of fresh salsa and tortilla chips.  YUM!
author: Lori B.

description: I have cravings for La Playa's shrimp burrito!  It will leave you very full if you can finish it, so I recommend saving a portion for later.  Yummy.
author: Kara C.

description:
I'm biased to this place because it's really close to my house.  I go here because I love Mexican food and once again, it's close to my house.  I ony order a couple of things off their menus.  I don't normally eat burritos so I stick with the tacos.  You really can't f-up a taco.  You have a tortilla and you put meat on it.  I slap tons of hot sauce on mine so if it was suppose to taste bad, well, it didn't.  Hot sauce makes everything better in my book.  So having said that, I love their fish tacos and I sometimes get their nachos.  

Now on to the service.  The food comes out pretty quick if there isn't a line of people already waiting.  You can totally see what's happening in the kitchen so you know they're moving fast.  The girl at the counter needs to work on her people skills.  She is either 1. scared of people or 2. hates her job or maybe 3. both a and b.  Anyways, this place is decent, only because it's close to my house and I like hot sauce.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Sometimes you gotta know when not to be picky. La Playa is one of those type of places. The food is ok; nothing special, but decent enough to not have to drive to the mission and look for parking. Really, not that many choices in outer sunset. I've had most on the menu, and although they have fish and shrimp, I recommend sticking to the basics: carna asada and carnitas.
author: Dom L.

description:
Whenever I'm craving for mexican food and don't want to travel far, I toss on some comfy clothes and make my way down to La Playa Taqueria.  On my way there, I pass by a laundrymat called beachwash, a surf store, a cafe that has an ocean theme, then I walk into La Playa Taqueria and see some more waves.  Makes me think of my yearly visits to Hawaii and gives me the feeling of relaxation.... until I walk up to the register.
Three years ago, I would come here on a regular basis and was always greeted with a happy-go-lucky guy at the register.  I always ordered nachos with chicken, which was my fave since their chips are always thin and crispy.  All of a sudden, I stopped going and recently started coming back again.
Nowadays, I'm always greeted by a woman who seems like she's always tired and barely ever smiles.  I saw that the fish tacos were good so I gave one a try.  I ordered a baja fish taco for a little snacky.  The size of the taco was decent as they put a lot of stuffing into it.  The batter of the fish was crispy, but extremely greasy and I crunched on two fish bones, which totally ruined my fish taco experience from here. The nachos are packed with an absurd amount of toppings.  I've never complained about having too much of something, but once I open the container, all I can think about is.. where the hell are all of the chips!?  I don't know about you, but I like nachos with crispy chips and not drenched soggy ones.  I literally get an average of three chips that still have their corners exposed and eat those first. I usually end up walking back home and having to scoop up toppings with tortilla chips that I already have at home and tossing away all the soggy ones at the bottom of the container.
You get a small bag of chips with salsa with every order (unless you order nachos).
They're cash only and have an ATM inside.
author: Cheryl Q.

description: I found this place because El Burrito on Taraval was closed. Anyway, I like this place much better. First off, it's really close to my house and I think the burritos they make here have so much more flavor. Also, the tortilla chips and salsa taste really fresh. The employees aren't the friendliest, but they're okay. Do know what you want before you walk up to the register to order though. They don't like it when you dilly dally.
author: Audrey T.

description: Avoid at all cost Im surprised it is still open. I know food places are limited in the sunset but this should need even be an option. Ive eaten here a few times and always seem to be disappointed in my meal. Beans are not that great rice is sticky and gritty and the steak doesnt taste all that great either. If you want mexican food burrito express on taraval is a bit better.
author: Michael W.

description: Please don't go there. Was there a couple of weeks ago to get a burrito. They were kind enough to include two huge bones, just lovely.
author: Elodie P.

description:
A couple of friends live in the sunset and this is where we go in the morning if we end up there after a late night. I've only had the breakfast burritos, but they're decent and moderately priced. Two things I'm not a fan of:

1) The woman at the counter. She's not pleasant and makes it difficult for me to come back.
2) Their unjustifiable inflexibility. I asked for a different meat in the burrito and was more than willing to pay for it, and the woman looked me dead in the eyes and said no. On another visit, my friend wanted to get a bean and cheese burrito and they shot her down even though they clearly have the immensely complex ingredients necessary. I don't understand this one at all, especially since a bean and cheese burrito would be both easier and cheaper for them than anything they have on the menu.
author: Jenny Z.

description: I eaten here twice. The last time I got crazy food poisoning, the only time I have ever had it in my life. I was hallucinating all night having the craziest dreams
author: johnny s.

description: I don't even live in the city, but ALWAYS ALWAYS come here for their SHRIMP BURRITO. It is that good.
author: Natalie W.

description: Okay so I got a Super Wet Steak Burrito. The Burrito was good, but the next day I woke up and threw up a few times and was not able to produce a bowel movement. I did not have a Bowel movement for 4 days after this burrito. Don't go here unless you plan on being impacted for most of a week.
author: Mike F.

description: i just live around the block that's why i'm a regular here, i love their veggie burrito and i totally recommend it. it's one of my fav of SF. nevertheless i don't like the ambiente and the lady who works the register (pretty rude) that's y i usually order take out ;)
author: Chris V.

description: Just got back from Brasil and I was biking down to the beach and I spotted this taqueria so I decided to grab a bite to eat .  For a Mexican place in the outer sunset I was very satisfied with my super chicken in red sauce burrito. I look forward to try other items on the menu on my next bike ride.
author: Oscar R.

description: I can't believe this place isn't rated higher. We go here all the time - delicious and reasonably priced. The pork isn't so great (I've only tried a pork burrito though), but everything else I have tried has been awesome.
author: Clutch R.

description: Wow... there are a lot of single star ratings.  Not sure why.  I've been to La Playa Taqueria a number of times, tried different things, and been very satisfied (in an "Oh mi GAWD why did I eat so much?!" sort of way) every time.  The food here far surpasses the taqueria near my house on Judah.  In fact, I'm hungry...
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
I love love love that they give you fresh pico with everything you order.  This place has definitely raised the bar on burrito freshness in my collection of taquerias.

Definitely the best Taqueria in the outer sunset... maybe the only?  But also one of the best to-go places.
author: Daniel H.

description:
This is a good little spot for Mexican food.  They have the usual fare but I usually get the steak quesadilla...it's pretty huge and they have to cut it in 4 pieces..it's tasty!

My bf usually gets the shrimp tacos with their special chipotle sauce that gives it that extra kick!

Their prices are fairly reasonable and the service is friendly...the best thing is: they're close to home!!!

One thing: the young girl at the counter could be a little friendlier...when someone says "thank you" it would be nice if the person would respond with a "you're welcome!" not just a roll of the eyes!
author: Jade B.

description:
my fingers still smell like fish tacos as i type this.

I had a mahi mahi mango salsa taco here today....it was alright........ive had better.  The fish didnt really have any fish taste, but it was stuffed with mangoes! Came with free chips and salsa, but i also bought a guac for $.75 and a mexican coke, mmmmmm what a good combo for a pre-dinner snack.

my friend ordered the nachos, pretty good, not very oily like other places where you find the puddle of oil from the cheese on the bottom of the plate when youre done eating.  He ended up having no chips and a lot of toppings left, its usually the other way around.

clean bathrooms, nice people. a-ok.
author: kim w.

description: While I'm writing this, I am sitting in La Playa while eating a chille relleno burrito (which is el bomb) and listening to one of the ladies sing along to the radio. It's gorgeous outside and I'm thinking about grabbing a tecate and heading to the beach or the actual "playa", I guess. Also, the lady who rings up the orders always has the best manicure. She knows it too. Because I tell her every time I come in. I know that isn't relevant, but it makes ME happy.
author: Emily B.

description: The nachos here were amazing and filled with flavor. The chips are so fresh, and the portions are good for its price. Other than that, it seems like your ordinary taqueria.
author: Bik H.

description: The food here is mediocre at best...the service deplorable.... Three stars for food but honestly, if your in the neighborhood and your feeling lazy just walk the extra couple blocks to Judah.
author: Tito T.

description:
I had food from here before, like one night when I was reeeeallllly craving carne asada tacos. My fiance went over and got me 4. I later figured that they are HUUGE!! and I could only eat 2. 
We live 2 blocks away so its a pretty convenient place to get take out. 
This time I ordered 2 carne asada tacos to go also and by the time we got home they were coldish. We live 2 blocks away!!! How can they possibly get cold in like the 2 minutes it takes us to literally drive from here home??? My fiance likes the chile relleno burrito. I guess I just have to eat the tacos there for them to be hot. What's up with those huge taco tortillas, I feel like the smaller tortillas give the tacos a more savory feel.
author: Luis and Yona V.

description:
I have eaten here at least a dozen times and finally have something to say about Lay Playa.

After ordering your burrito at the counter you may immediately regret it because the staff is far from friendly and always looks at you in a way that makes you feel very unwelcome. I honestly don't like giving them my money because I feel their poor customer service does not deserve it.

The burritos are generally ok. I have yet to have a burrito that can compare with the simple Taco Truck burritos I used to get back in the Central Valley for $3.50 a pop. The mojado burritos step it up a little but are way overpriced and you might as well go to a place with better service if your ready to drop close to $8+ for a specialty burrito.

Basically, if your in the area, want a burrito, dont care for good customer service - then this place will suit you fine. If your searching for a new place to eat and will be traveling here, you might want to reconsider.
author: Haymose P.

description:
first time i went i had the wet burrito. it ended up being a bit to salty. so i go for either a regular/super carne or carnitas.

but the one i keep going back to is the breakfast burrito. a little bit cheaper, and will keep you full half a day easy.
author: Ross K.

description: They are okay.  They are pretty consistent and serve decent burritos of good value.  They don't blow me away.  I think they could ad some salsa into their burritos as they wrap it - varying levels of spiciness and that would turn their burritos from okay to awesome.  What I will say is the burritos are very large and they are always very nice.
author: Heather K.

description: First bite, pretty good-getting excited! Second bite, wtf? ... fat. A huge chunk. Like half the size of my little finger. Ok, well I ordered carnitas, so maybe a little bit didn't get the treatment .. yeah did I mention it wasn't crispy? fat doesn't scare me..ribeye? Yes plz! Etc... But this fat never saw the hot oil. Anyways , third bite, Fat! Again , steam--textured and huge. I got a plate and opened it up... 3/4 of the pork content was nasty un-fried soft white rubbery fat. The rest of the meat was ok but  after picking the bad parts out and noticing after all this that I got the wrong beans, I was over it. Circular File. To be honest I don't remember Wat the other ingredients were like... meh
author: Moocifer M.

description: Avoid this place if you can. It's cheap, but the quality of what they sell is definitely going downhill. They left out the guacamole once, and when I (a regular customer) asked politely for a little extra the next time I went in, the Napoleon guy behind the register got argumentative and told me to take it up with the woman who had made it. Total B.S.  If you must buy something, check your burrito right away so you don't get cheated like I did. They deserve to go out of business
author: Carey G.

description: La Playa Taqueria is the right spot in the Outer Sunset to have a satisfying burrito or plate of nachos. It's guilty pleasure food that makes you feel like you're back in college when you could only afford the best inexpensive burrito lifestyle. The food is made to order, the carne asada is always cooked perfectly and they're homemade chips are fresh and delicious!. It's conveniently located near the beach. So on that rare warm sunny day in the Sunset, I suggest you order a burrito and have a seat at la playa!
author: Tashina G.

description: The fish tacos could almost elevate it from three up to four stars.  Otherwise, pretty lackluster. I wish they would answer their phone when I'm calling in a order -- half the time they do not.
author: Kevin B.

description:
it's deplorable that this little gem isn't more highly rated. the flavors are fresh like the ocean air around this place and make for some of the best Mexican food in all of San Francisco- not just against the Sunset. It easily rivals the best of the Mission.  

I highly recommend the mahi-mahi tacos with a mango pico de gallo. The mahi-mahi tastes succulent and they don't over-fry it.

I can also recommend the steak and shrimp burrito- at first I didn't think this could be such delectable combination- but contrary to my assumptions- it was.

Those who give this place two stars or less are asinine and petulant- and the rest of your thoughts on food are useless.
author: David S.

description:
OK WTH with all the bad reviews here??
Is there another La Playa that people are going to? Because I have never had a bad meal at this La Playa.
Dogs, Bums, surfers?? WTH are people complaining about? ITS TWO BLOCKS FROM THE BEACH!!!!!I Sheesh!!!

Anyhoo I always get either a Baja Fish Taco which comes with yummy guacamole, a Shrimp Taco which comes with a creamy chipotle sauce or a Mahi Mahi taco which comes with a mango salsa, thats right I said MANGO!
These are the best freaking tacos I have ever had and I challenge other reviewers to make a better taco.
My sweet baby is from So Cal and he KNOWS his fish tacos and if he says La Playa is the shizzle, you better believe it!
author: Catty C.

description:
I don't think I have ever had an appreciation for bell peppers until the day I ate a breakfast burrito from here--sans chorizo.

And it's the perfect hangover remedy, which makes me think I should have gone there this morning.

And it's bright and clean inside, which is amazing.

It's no Pancho Villa's or Lolita's, but it's close to where I live, so it will suffice.
author: Angela H.

description:
I was kind of hesitant about this place at first, but once I actually had the food here a couple of times, I was won over!  The vegetarian and breakfast burrito (served all day) are excellent, and they offer a very good mole sauce, and a wonderful creamy chipotle sauce.  

But the best thing about this place is the selection of breakfast specialties that they offer on Fridays and weekends!  The Ortega Chile burrito is a happy hot spicy combination of flavors, and my favorite there.

I definitely recommend this place for take-out rather than eat in, as it is very tiny.  But it is a pleasant enough environment to wait for food.

I only have two complaints, which are simple things that would improve the place enormously.  First, they don't deliver.  The only other burrito joint in the area that delivers is yucky, and I would rather go and fetch food from La Playa than have that other place bring the food to me.  The other suggestion is that they extend the breakfast end time from noon until 1.  I often arrive from my morning jobs right before noon, and based on lines I have seen queuing up about then, other folks are also rushing to get breakfast at the last minute before it ends.  And they are absolutely adamant about that 12 noon stop time.  A little flexibility would be appreciated, especially since the breakfasts seem so in demand.

But overall, it's a great place in the Sunset for food one usually has to drive across town for, and that counts for a lot!
author: Aldyth B.

description:
I'm a fan of seafood. I am also a fan of burritos. Thus I am a big fan of shrimp burritos. 

La Playa's shrimp burrito will leave you more than satisfied in the hunger department. Its got a chipotle sauce that's got quite a nice kick to it. They've also got a variation with a shrimp and steak burrito which is also great, no chipotle sauce though.

I've found that their veggie burritos are kind of hit or miss. I've gotten some that have been awesome....then i've got some that made me wish i went somewhere else. 

Other than that, great go to burrito place if you leave by the water.
author: Crystal A.

description:
Went back again.  Third time is the charm?  Not here.   

Promised myself to never waste my time agin.  ill stop at the Noreiga produce and eat a cookie instead.  

skip it
author: Johnny C.

description: I tried there new jalepeno torta sandwich, it was very good , do not be scared off by the the name jalepeno, it has just the right amount of heat mixed in with the steak and avocado, while I was there I see they serve breakfast on the weekends I look forward to trying one of there omlettes next time, thanks for the good service la playa
author: Mark O.

description: I grew up in the Mission.  I ate at a taqueria at least once a week growing up.  I now live in the outer sunset and when I crave mexican i  have to go here.  Its within walking distance and well.... it's within walking distance.  The people who work there are always friendly and provide good service.  Don't order the carnitas, it's always SOGGY.  Order the GRILLED CHICKEN,.  I'm dreaming of an el farolitos in the outer sunset.... how sweet would that be!  quesadilla suizas and burritos with the proper amount of...everything...
author: Regina V.

description:
Update 10-15-07

Get the steak and shrimp burrito.  Go!  Now.  Double YUM.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It smelled amazing when we walked in.  The shrimp tacos were YUM.  The baja fish tacos were good but stuffed with too much cabbage.  Very reasonable in price.  Can't wait to try some of the other menu items.
author: C C.

description:
I've lived in the Outer Sunset my whole life and I know how limited our Mexican dining options are, but La Playa has been a life saver for my family and me.  Before La Playa, we were forced to go to El Burrito Express for Burritos (Gross).  

Being the Burrito Connoisseur that I am, I stumbled upon La Playa a couple of years ago when it first opened.  It might not be the best Burrito in the city but I can guarantee satisfaction.  I've taken a lot of my friends from the Mission to La Playa and at first they seem hesitant to try a Sunset Burrito. But all have left impressed.  

I recommend the Chicken Mole w/ Black Beans.. Awesome!!

Don't forget their Red Hot Sauce - Tasty with a big kick.
author: Justin O.

description:
Hit and miss. Sometimes 2 stars, sometimes 3.  I'm still looking for the signature dish that will make me come back for more.  Generally, the meats are salty and charred.  Will I come back?  Yeah, gotta support the neighborhood businesses, plus the next best burrito spot  is 40 blocks away. I'm too lazy to drive that far for a "burrito".

Cudos to the friendly staff, fresh chips and salsa, and for selling bottled cokes.
author: Ezduzit S.

description: Inexpensive Mexican food that tastes great.
author: Cassandra C.

description:
man... it really is slim pickins out by the beach. everytime i find myself out there i always have a tough time getting satisfaction from the options presented. la playa taqueria is just another one of the reasons i need to remember to eat before heading out that way.

but in a sense i suppose that at least they have this place. something is better than nothing. sure this place has all the usual stuff on the menu one might expect at a taqueria. but its delivery is for sure subpar. my carne asada burrito was D grade. 

on a plus note i will say that the joint is set up very well. they go with the whole "oceanside theme" which is usually tacky but in this case i  feel they pull it off quite well, and it complemented the very friendly staff. 

but when all is said and done id rather go the extra distance and go with burrito express on taraval or basically any other taqueria in the city. after all... why would anyone expect to find a "incredibly good taqueria" out by the beach?
author: Andrew D.

description: Okay, the highlights: pretty good portions; really good hot sauce and pico de gallo; burritos and enchiladas decent. Not the best - but the location gives them a near monopoly on Mexican food. In the recent past, the food quality was inconsistent, but that seems to have changed over the past month or two. Now the bad: 1) if you live in the Sunset, the question becomes do you have the time or patience to drive to the Mission; 2) (and this one is an issue in many of the places in the Outer Sunset), pretty unfriendly service - not sure if its because of the near constant cloud cover or fog or what; 3) the chicken here is really not that good at all; and 4) all this talk of how great the seafood is coupled with the reports of gastro-intestinal issues leaves me wary of ordering these items, and taken with the previous point, the best way to go is either steak or carnitas.
author: Sandeep C.

description:
i really wanted a 5 star, i really really wanted it!

la playa just didn't deliver the one time i was there. she got a steak/shrimp burrito. i got a breakfast burrito. neither was awesome, tho i can't say bad.

i'm going to come back one day, and we'll have a round 2. perhaps better results next time!
author: Ameer N.

description: living in chinatown (outer sunset), i was very pleased to find a taqueria down the street from me. buuuut here's the thing. i think the best way to describe it is it's kind of like a methadone clinic. if you are absolutely in desperate need for a fix, you know, you've got the shakes and only a burrito can calm you down, then it's ok. it's not that great. but it's there. i just sometimes don't want to make an all day venture out to the mission!
author: Liz M.

description:
Awesome steak and shrimp burritos! The fish tacos are okay, but nothing to call home about. Everything else I've tried is pretty great. 

My only complaints would be that they rarely get any extras right. Meaning if you say you want a side of sour cream or jalapenos and onions or something, you WILL have to remind them about it. Too many times have I placed a phone order hoping for extra chips or the like and find that while I was charged for the item(s), they aren't there.

And they're just a little on the pricey side for taquerias. Not too horrible and by no means a reason not to go, but be prepared for an $8-9 burrito as opposed to the Mission District $6 ones.
author: Scott G.

description: I have been going to this restaurant off and on since it opened.  When it opened it was great clean, tasty and decent portions.  Well I don't know what happened the food has gone why down hill right along with the service.  We stopped going there because their burritos got so small, a SUPER vegetarian should be just that super in size WRONG!  We didn't feel like cooking an decided to try it again and the same thing a burrito so small that half of it is folder over tortilla, which means most of your bites are just tortilla when I tried to explain this to the woman behind the counter she could care less, kept telling me if I wanted more I would have to pay more. So charge more and make a decent sized burrito what is wrong with that. Either get a smaller tortilla or fill it more the concept was to much for her to handle.  Not to mention the first three bites were just lettuce she did make a new one with items more evenly distributed but the fold was still there, definitely not the mission and definitely not going back.  Feel bad because the guy who owns it has been around the neighborhood for decades and the people who run his restaurant are not doing him any favors.
author: A H.

description:
Pretty great place.

The Three Pepper Burrito was awesome. Very flavorful, good size and reasonably priced. The first time it was delicious, the second time it was kinda dry and lacked any real flavor. The chips are average but are included with the burrito. The hot sauce is good.

The fish tacos baja style are just ok, I've had a lot better. But then again, SF is not known for having great tacos, like down in SoCal.

Stay with the burritos here and you'll be happy.
author: Chili B.

description:
Decent little taqueria.

After meeting up with my friend next door at Sea Biscuit, we went over to La Playa for a quick bite. My chicken burrito was pretty decent...not great, but definitely tasty enough to warrant a return trip. It's true that the salsa was pretty eh, but no worries.

They don't take cards, so take cash...they do have an ATM though.

I'm looking forward to trying the fish tacos...mmm....
author: Jerold B.

description: Ok I really can't comment on all the other stuff they have, I guess it's just ok, but the Pollo Rojo is awesome!! I would suggest checking that they have it before you go there. Service is so so, the one guy always working there during the day is not very nice, but the woman that works at night is really nice.
author: matteo v.

description:
Banging burrito's. 
The Steak and shrimp burrito is the Cadillac of all burritos. then the chorizo breakfast burrito (served all day) is also a consistent winner. 

I recommend ordering "to go" if your party is more then 2, there is just no place to sit. For two people its nice and cozy though. 
But blocks from OB and your just that close to a burrito and a beer at the beach, no-matter what time of day.
author: Delta d.

description: I ordered the vegetarian burrito with no sour cream.  The lady at the front got my order wrong.  Then i was informed i didn't order it that way, after she asks the guy in the back how i ordered it?  I hope you're as confused as i was.  Besides my burrito tasting like the inside may have been dipped in mayonnaise, it overall was very very mediocre.  Maybe 10 black beans in the whole burrito, the beans should've been the bulk of the burrito, and on top of that the guacamole was not good.  This place was a waste of five dollars.  This is not a place i will be returning to.
author: Cole F.

description: All of the tacos here is really tasty, 5 stars for Tacos but over all it's 4 stars because they didn't have the sauces bar, and the Salsa wasn't good. Anyways, Shrimp Taco is my favorite.
author: Michiko V.

description:
Just an ok taqueria.  It does the trick when you're hungry for Mexican and you're out in the Boonies, er, the Sunset.  I hate that they put peas and carrots in their rice.  Any time I order a vegetarian burrito, it's comes out cold.  The fish tacos with the mango salsa is really good.  

The service is generally friendly, but I'm sorry to say they are not too bright.  They always mess up my order (like when I asked for a quesadilla with a side of refried beans, they put the beans inside the quesadilla), they can't count change too well (make sure you know how much you need back), and often when calling in a to go order, they ask if I can hold for a minute then never come back on the line.  There have been other times I called and their phone was off the hook for an hour.
author: Kandi K.

description:
A great lil hole in the wall in the outer sunset...

the people who work there are chill, the  chips are crispy and sometimes warm, the salsa is fresh. 

my favorite is the shrimp burrito with chipotle sauce on a spinach tortilla, and black beans (6.25)... makes me salivate...
author: Mookey G.

description:
tried the nachos and breakfast burrito and quesadilla.
food is alright, nachos were very filling, lots of toppings. breakfast burrito wasn't that special and quesadilla was meh. only thng is its convenient and close by, but i think i'd rather drive to the mission to get my burritosss.
easy parking though
author: Christine M.

description: One of my favorite taquerias in the sunset. Great selection and quality burritos. I recommend the Mahi Mahi tacos. They are very generous with the portions and the staff has been nothing but friendly to me. Great place to grab a bite and head to the beach for while.
author: Ken R.

description:
I've been here twice so far, and have found myself being satisfied. 
I absolutely recommend trying the Steak Fajita Burrito with sour cream.
The place is original and looks very quaint, since they've put a lot of effort into decorating it.
The service is very friendly and fast. So if you want Mexican food served with a smile, this is your place to go.
author: Roger W.

description:
I always order the shrimp burrito and look forward to taking the first bite.  It boasts this spicy chipotle sauce (that isn't really that spicy at all).  Only  after the second or third bite I realize it's not the fantastic goodness I made it out to be in my mind.  

To be fair that isn't the only item I order at La Playa Taqueria.  I've had the fish tacos and those are pretty straight forward.  Yet again nothing spectacular.

With all that said, this taqueria is decent if there isn't any other option.  The best way to describe the food here is awesomely bad eats.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Best Burrito on the West Side. Better than average. Better than the Burrito Express on Taraval.
author: Mosey S.

description: The hottest enchilladas I've ever had. I mean temperature hot. I literally couldn't pick up the box because it was so hot to the touch. It pretty much could have been boiling. After letting it cool, I dug it. Sometimes a cheap mexican meal just puts me in my happy place.
author: Jen Y.

description: Tastes more or less like most SF burritos (oh how i forever pine for socal mexican food). Not great but pretty good, and one of these reasons is because they don't give you hot sauce!! Apparently you have to ask for it but I have never experienced such a travesty before. I ordered the super veggie and my bf ordered the steak and shrimp burrito which seemed pretty damn good. The moral of the story is, don't forget to ask for hot sauce!
author: Katie S.

description: I ordered the shrimp burrito with chipotle sauce.  It was actually really good and a memorable burrito.  It was a good sunny day walking back from the beach and I decided to try it out.  From what I experienced the service was good and the burrito was really good.  Definitely go for the shrimp burrito if you have a choice.  It is worth the extra dollar or two to make a more memorable experience.
author: Michael L.

description: good days, and sometimes a bad day. very close to the house so it's usually when we hit the peak laziness of a day we head on over here. mostly we just stick to grill chicken burrito, with just veggies and rice or the nachos. roommate loves their breakfast burrito, which i am still inclined to try.
author: Abigail W.

description:
Convenient, usually quick, and decent burritos.

Customers service is good, except when one particular man is working...don't know his name, but he's a bit rude and short...unless you speak Spanish.
author: Cathy W.

description: I've decided to upgrade my review to 4 stars because La Playa is still my go-to mexican food fix in the Sunset. The Chipotle sauce used on the shrimp burritos is crave-worthy. You can order a side of it to put on anything they make, and that's a good thing. The only downside is a little inconsistency in the quality of burritos depending on who is working. A great burrito is all about the right proportions of ingredients well distributed and mingled. Not a lump of rice here, a lump of cheese there.
author: L J.

description:
Decided to give this place a second try.  I showed up about 8:45pm-ish.  The woman asked if I wanted anything because they were about to close.  Closing time is 9pm.  

I said two carnitas tacos please.

She replied: We already cleaned the grill; nothing from the grill.

That was that, and so I drove over to Gordos on 9th.
author: James Y.

description: Love their breakfast burrito on weekend and 3 pepper burrito every other time...ask for salsa verde.  This is obviously not the best burrito in the city, but it's a solid outer sunset option.
author: Emily S.

description: I want to love this place, I really do.  I've given it a good 15 tries before I had to officially break up with them yesterday.  It's the only burrito place within miles and the food is halfway decent.  But the people who work there are ALWAYS in a bad mood and they eff up my order about half the time. Hubs called it quits with them months ago after they consistently gave him the runs. Unfortunately, it's the best restaurant on west Noriega.  But unfortuniatelier, it sucks.
author: Jeanine J.

description:
for the same $$, drive up to 22nd & Taraval and get some good dependable Taco Bell. unless you're totally shitfaced. then these burritos will fill your belly and absorb some of that booze.

friggin surfer dudes/wannabes and their stinkin humongous dogs. am I the only person who loves a little lap pooch ? prepare to step over dog shit when entering & exiting. how f-ing appetizing.
author: Prima D.

description:
Eaten here a few times and I've never been overly impressed... until I got the steak and shrimp burrito yesterday (only $7! I feel like for steak and shrimp I'd expect to pay 7.50 or $8 in a lot of places).  

The burrito would have been just okay, except the shrimp were soooo delicious!  They must have been cooked with garlic butter or something, tasted like shrimp you'd get in a fancy dish at a nice restaurant. Delicious! Now I'm going to start craving La Playa all the time like some of my friends...

(some of my friends have stopped talking about things in terms of money but rather in terms of La Playa... like "going out to a movie matinee costs about one La Playa." That's how often they eat there.)
author: Brandi C.

description: I guess this place is half decent.  Got a pollo asado torta nothing special.  Not the traditional torta OR pollo asado I am used to.  Tasted more like BBQ chicken.  Bogus.  Decent though not spicy, salsa with chips.
author: Blake C.

description: It's nice that over the last few years the neighborhood has added a couple of more Mexican food places. Sadly, this isn't the greatest. Their rice is always kinda hard, and their salsa although fresh, isn't ripe. I stick to anything with chipotle sauce because they have a really tasty one and it pretty much covers up anything less than tasty. Well, at least they're friendly and fast.
author: Dixon T.

description: Pricier than El Burrito Express and not as good quality/taste, IMO.
author: Mag N.

description:
Quite simply a delicious burrito in the Sunset! 
Nice people, too. Try the breakfast burrito some morning. Great if you're hung over.
author: Jeff H.

description: Horrible food and slow service. I ordered the vegetarian nachos- how can I screw that one up. My nachos had cheese, salsa, whole beans, and chips which would have been great but the beans were an odd color and extremely tasteless. I like my food with some spice so I asked the cashier for  some jalapenos being that I did not see a salsa/condiment bar. She said they were extra and proceeded to go to the back which at this point, I thought she was going to grab me some.  She comes back with no jalapenos and continues to assist the long line of customers she had waiting. I would not have minded the wait but when one goes to the back after being asked for something, one would think that their request is being attended to. So I quickly finished my nachos because I was starving and swore I would never go back there again.
author: Zannie S.

description: This taqueria does it in a pinch.  The burritos are decent -- fresh ingredients and tightly rolled/constructed.  The line is never really huge either on weeknights or weekends.  The free chips and salsa accompanying the burrito are just okay -- supplement the meal with Casa Sanchez chips n' salsa from Noriega Produce next door.
author: K W.
