description: Not really feeling their food.  Just moved in close by and have tried a couple different burritos.  If they were good (not great) I would go back, but they're stuff just ain't that flavorful at all.  Every element is meh - rice, beans, meat.
author: F U.

description: I just ate food from here. My stomach feels really uneasy =(
author: Vivian L.

description: Best burrito..........in the sunset.  Order the surf and turf. I like the peas in the rice--it is unexpected.
author: Mar M.

description: Suck suck suck. Why would i even kid myself and get mexican food outside of the mission. The salsa taste like little slices of nothing. BAD
author: Chris L.

description: 4 stars only for their Breakfast Burrito. Everything else is average or better at other places.... but I will go out of my way to get one of their great breakfast burritos! The right mix of flavor, proportion and consistency. All less than $4. Ask for extra hot sauce, it's homemade! I always take some home to spice up my dishes.
author: Nikka B.

description: don't be fooled by the haters.  this is the best taqueria west of stanyan.  i used to live around the block from el farolito until the internet ruined the mission.  this is the next best thing for us working class refugees biding our time in the avenues, waiting for the next big one to drive the vermin back whence they came.
author: Kyle M.

description: Ok, so i live in the neighborhood and never tried this joint til yesterday.  I woke up from a bad hangover and needed to find a fix.  i figure i'll stop by and it did wonders for my hangover.  I had the breakfast chorizo burrito and it was huge and tasteful.  It was also pretty dam cheap.  I had to get me a jarritos since i was here also.  I'll be back to try the breakfast platters.   It ends at 12 though.
author: Hugh L.

description: Ok, silly me I forgot I wasn't a fan of La Playa. The "super" burrito was completely flavorless, really, but hey at least they got rid of the carrot and peas in the rice.
author: Rachel B.

description: okay so this play is so-so. for a quick mexican craving, this will suffice. however it will be sometime until i go back because the last time i ordered carnitas, they tasted a little fishy - literally. if your desperate, la playa is your place to go, but if you have a little time on your hands then dont be afraid to search a little harder.
author: Daniel C.

description: Small.  Yellow.  Tasty.  The chorizo breakfast burrito is delicious!!!  Pretty humble place with very nice people working there.  When I think of their burritos, my toes curl.
author: Curtis H.

description: i normally go there about once a week and pretty good price for the size of the serving. in any case there is a good selection and live entertainment. the only thing about the entertainment you gotta watch out for the brat whenever he swings his toys and while he is riding his brat powered harley. he actually crashed into me and made me drop my food and what is worse is he ran over it and started laughing about it like it was funny. i wanted to pull his pants down and whoop his bare ass but it will only result in me going to jail.
author: mister f.

description: Hands down best baja-style (fried) fish tacos I have found in San Francisco.  Nuff said!
author: Shane L.

description: Not Great.  Not Bad.  What I'll say for them is that everything seems very fresh.  When I am in the neighborhood, want to eat a burrito, I don't want to wait too long in line, then this is the spot.  Otherwise, I take a drive up to El Burrito Express on Taraval.....
author: Mark W.

description:
If you want real Mexican food, a visit to the Mission District is mandatory. If you are in the Sunset and want mexican food, this is the place to go. Your options in the Sunset are limited (The only other taqueria's I can think of is El Burrito Express and Celia's; both not worth your hard earned money)

I frequent La Playa because I live 2 blocks away and it is very convenient. The best item on their menu is the Fajita Burrito. The Carne Asada super burrito is also very good. The Fish tacos are great but only if you eat them there (Fish Tacos do not travel well!!!).  The Super Nachos are bomb!! Unfortunately the tortilla chips they serve on the side are stale half the time and the salsa is down right awful.

It is definitely the best Taqueria in the Sunset, but you can do way better in the City. They have pretty good service and it is reasonably priced, but the Mission should always be your destination if you want to grub on Mexican.
author: Paul H.

description: I'm originally from Southern California, so there are of course "better" burritos in LA...but for the Outer Sunset, this place is a gem! It was just a couple blocks from my place (always lots of parking available!), and would be a perfect treat when I was too tired to cook or it was a long day. I would tend to default to the fajita burrito -- loved the bell peppers and onions. Make sure to ask for salsa/hot sauce, if you like a little extra spice! They are very quick (if you call in an order, you can pick it up within 10 minutes, usually) and tend to be consistent. The staff was always friendly enough to me. I would say that sometimes the food is a tad salty -- I think it's the chicken that gets over-seasoned. Otherwise, though, it's really good -- not enough to make a special trip out to the Outer Sunset, but if you're in the area looking for a satisfying meal, it's a great place. I prefer here to The Beach Burrito on Judah. There aren't very many tables/seats, but most people are getting food to-go.
author: Tina H.

description: I really like the shrimp burrito at La Playa... even if I didn't live in the Outer Sunset, I would crave it.  They have really good fresh chips that come with the burritos, and their tacos are great, too.  My husband isn't as much of a fan of La Playa as I am, but I'd eat here once a week if he didn't protest each time with "you want another damn burrito for dinner?"  It's right next to the Sea Biscuit, so there are always lots of surfers hanging out in the front with their dogs.
author: robyn s.

description:
probably the best burrito place in outer sunset, but i can only think of two... 

burritos are good, but i think its because they use yellow cheese and alot of grease. grease is delicious.  no joke, its flavor baby.  

pico da gallo is very good, but they only give you one little sauce cup of it while i could probably eat 4 or 5 of them things
author: Doug ..

description: The steak and shrimp burrito is the bomb...seriously! The service is awesome! It's a california style taco joint in the sunset! It's priced reasonably!
author: Elle G.

description: wtf. what a disappointment. i haven't had a burrito over months n i came here with a friend cus i was starving! so i ordered my usual.. super chicken burrito NO BEANS JUST RICE AND EVERYTHING ELSE.. the guy with goggly eyes (huge eyes) had some sort of hearing problem.. i explain to him over n over n he said, "what?! no rice.. no beans?" i said, NO BEANS JUST RICE.. is that hard to understand? i wasn't chewing any gum or anything.. i'm pretty sure he can hear me right. welps he gave me some sort of attitude. then i finally got to eat my burrito. i notice that i didn't get any beans.. which is good cus i don't want beans. but i notice i didn't get any rice either. ok wtf! so disappointing. i'll stick my usual joint over at mission.. what is it call? el farolito. that place is a lot better.
author: Valerie N.

description: 2.5 stars. Just a notch below El Burrito. Steak burrito was decent, but um.. it was just missing something. The chips were really dry and they didn't come with salsa.
author: Katherine C.

description: The decor and polite staff make the tiny space feel welcoming if you decide to eat inside. The burritos and nacho plates are some of the best I've had anywhere. My only critique is that there is no salsa bar and no salsa on the menu. I bring my own usually, but if even Baja has a bar, La Playa should as well.
author: Guy I.

description: I love thier steak and shrimp burritos 9fairly priced at around 6.50)... their chips are warm and fresh, and their salsa is cold and fresh. great service, awesome location (right near da beach mon!)... La playa is alwways god to go in my book!
author: Allen W.

description: They lost me as a customer tonight.  I went in 15 minutes before they closed and the lady at the register refused to make me a fish burrito.  She actually said "it would cost too much" to tell me she wouldn't make it.  I live close by and have been there many times before, and that lady has always had a bad attitude, but I've always let it slide because it's so convenient.  Guess I'll have to stop being lazy and go down to Beach Burrito on Judah from now on.
author: Lon S.

description: I tried this place awhile ago and wasn't that happy with it but decided to give it another try.  I'm glad I did because I can see that they've really improved.  Maybe they've got a a new cook...who knows.  All I can say is I've been back a couple of times and each time it was very good.  I tried their super veggie burrito and it was killer.  The last time I was there I had their cheese enchiladas and they were excellent.  The only thing I would do differently next time would be to ask for a little sour cream and guac on the side.  The prices are really reasonable so I don't know where people are getting this dirt cheap Mexican food (unless they're talking Taco Bell) but my super burrito was around $4 and my enchilada dinner (3 enchiladas, rice, beans and salad) came to just over $6.  This place is the best taqueria in the Outer Sunset--believe me.
author: Rabbit B.

description: I liked the decoration of this place so me and my boyfriend decided to walk in and see what they had. I did get a fish taco but it was just OK. You can also tell that this place is also American-lized. (is that how you spell it) Sorry. I ate there once and never went back. I don't think I will anytime soon because there is a burrito joint by our house.
author: Ge I.

description:
I would've given this place 4 stars if it wasn't for the crappy service when I went there yesterday afternoon. I love their food, and the very first time I went there, I had the friendliest service from the guy taking the order. When my friend mentioned to me that it'd be cold to sit by the door, he offered to close it for us. He's also pretty funny if you're in the mood for small talk, but not pushy about it. Super nice guy. I have no idea where he went but the guy who was there the next few times was a total jackass! He always gives off a moody vibe and today, he misheard what I said and took down the wrong order. I asked for a steak and shrimp BURRITO and he thought I said steak QUESADILLA.  Yeah I guess it was an honest mistake (a really stupid one), but it wouldn't have even bothered me if he wasn't so incredibly rude about it. I didn't know he took down the wrong order until the quesadilla was done and when I said that I ordered a burrito, he raised his voice and pointed at me, yelling "I SWEAR to god you did not say that YOU said STEAK QUESADILLA!". Overdramatic much?! Can someone please go there and give this guy a lesson in manners? He's has wavy black hair and is almost always there. Beware. Definitely top 5 on my list of worst service ever received. 

Oh yeah, the food. I've had burritos at a couple places and that one makes some good ones. Steak and shrimp burrito with black beans! Yum. But I still hate that one worker.
author: Kari G.

description:
Every time I tell myself never, NEVER again... then the occasion warrants, and thank god it's only my taste buds and not my G.I. tract that pays the fine.  Tonight my shrimp burrito was folded so that a thick double-wall of soggy tortilla ran down the entire center; dividing about 10 pinto beans on one side with lettuce, and a reservoir of scattered rice grains mixed in spicy sour cream on the other.  My first bite was a winner: the butt end had 4 nice little shrimp in it.  I found another later on in the other 3/4.  It was extremely bland and almost half way through I dissected it in hopes of extracting nourishment from the pinto beans that I had yet to find.  I was sad to find that my allotment of pinto beans measured one tablespoon, to two parts rice.  Aside from the mild spiciness, utterly bland and uninspired.  Just yuck.
I chopped the carcass and mixed it with kibble to serve  a slightly less particular friend.
For this particular item's fans:
L.P. Shrimp Burrito.
1 Flour tortilla
4-5 small shrimp, sauteed.
1 tbs cooked pintos 
2 tbs cooked rice
1/2 cup shredded iceberg lettuce
1/2 cup sour cream mixed with 5 packets of taco bell "fire".
-pour all items into bowl, microwave for 30 seconds, stir, repeat.
-empty contents onto flour tortilla.
-once wrapped, using fingers push center of burrito so that the burrito is divided in half by length. Then wrap tightly in tinfoil.

Ten bucks says it tastes the same.
One hundred dollars says the servers don't eat the menu items as is.
author: Philip P.

description:
The little dude that works there pissed me off severely about a month ago.  I am going to tell you about it.  
So I just rolled into town from a weekend of riding dirtbikes in Mendocino county.  I was sore, starving, tired, had road rage, etc... If you dont know there are not a lot of options for food in the Sunset in general, and it gets meager on a Sun night.  All I wanted was 2 steak and shrimp burritos.  One for me and one for my friend and some chips for Escobar.  It was about 3 min til 8 on Sun.  The sign in the window clearly stated that they were open til 8 on Sun.  There were about 3 people inside waiting for their food, but the other sign in the window said 'Closed.'  Now I have been there about 20 times in the last couple months.  So that little dude has seen my face plenty.  I am sure he bought an ipod or 2 with the amount of dinero I have given him.  Anyways, I poke my head in the door and politely ask if he could wrap a couple burritos up for me and my boy.  The little prick said they were closed and turned his back on me.  That pissed me off proper like.   I had pizza instead, which I absolutely was not in the mood for.   
So I boycotted them and eat less burritos.  Visited some other places some good some not so good.   
Yesterday my hunger strike ended.  I had a steak and shrimp burrito with chipotle sauce (he is charging an extra $.50 for that).  The truth of the matter is, it was delicious and filled me up.  The flavor that the sauce gives warrants the extra sratch.  Also my amigo behind the counter seemed happy to see me.  So my business with them will resume, till he pisses me off again.  
Note:  The chips and salsa are weak at best.  My dog is fine with the shitty chips.  Since I don't eat them he gets them all.  Apparently he is more into quantity than quality, who would have known?  And if you have read this far you can probably deduce that the little man behind the counter can be unpleasent.  However, the burritos always deliver.
author: Chris A.

description: Excellent veggie burritos. (They grill the tortillas--always a plus!) And their breakfast burritos are even better!
author: Maria R.

description: I WANT to love this place...I really do. I love Mexican food - and  La Playa is just a block away from my house. I try, whenever possible, to support the businesses in my immediate neighborhood.  I've eaten La Playa's food on several occasions (usually purchased to go)...and I'll have to say that a few of those times the food was extremely delicious.  I've ordered and enjoyed the nachos, the chiles rellenos, the veggie burritos, the steak and the chicken burritos and the shrimp chipotle burrito - they all tasted good - well, except that the meat inside the steak burrito was horribly salty - other than that ok.  But, there are several MAJOR MAJOR drawbacks to La Playa Taqueria.  First of all, it is not uncommon to get an order to go, get back home and find out that you did NOT get what you ordered.  And, well,  here's the BIGGEST PROBLEM - I've gotten sick after going there - on 3 separate occasions now - once after eating a "vegetarian burrito" - which makes me wonder...hmmm...how can they screw up veggies that bad??  And, their BEST TASTING burrito, the shrimp chipotle burrito, which is absolutely delicious- has given me major stomach problems on 2 separate occasions - once, about 6 months ago I got the runs after eating one - and about 6 weeks ago I ordered one, came home, ate it around 8:30 pm and felt sick to my stomach about 30 minutes later.  I went to bed at 11 pm, and woke up at 1:00 in the morning and threw up over and over for hours on end...so, I'm thinking food poisoning...I'm thinking  that I can't trust this place...ever again...even though I WANT to love it - I can't go back there again.  I have noticed that one of the male employees is very dirty-looking and his hands are dirty too - maybe that's why I got sick.  I also wonder if maybe their seafood and meat is not being kept at the correct temperature.  When I looked up the history of restaurant inspections for La Playa Taqueria on http://sf.everyblock.com , I found that in years past there were 3 inspections made due to complaints for "food borne illness." In any case, I can't chance it...I can't go back...I think maybe they need to be inspected by the Health Department again really soon!
author: Karyn Ann B.

description: Taqueria La Playa is close to my home and I have eaten there many times.  The regular breakfast burrito is excellent with or without chorrizo.  The Baja fish taco platter is another excellent choice.  I also recommend the steak and shrimp burrito.  The service is friendly and fast and the prices are relatively cheap.
author: Roger P.

description: Like other reviewers, I live nearby this place and go out of convenience, but I am going to stop. I am consistently disappointed with the food. I want it to be great and it's just blah. The salsa is awful, and if  a mexican place can't make good salsa, that's bad. But more importantly, the service is terrible. Why is that short guy with the crappy attitude chosen to represent this restaurant? What is the owner thinking? And when he's not skulking behind the register that nervous, weird woman is, who makes every transaction painful. They should take a page out of Dimitri's book!
author: jill a.

description: The worst customer service!!!!  While the 3 employees were towards the back talking, I stood there waiting for someone to take my order.  When I said "hello, I would like to order something" they looked at me like I was interupting their very important conversation.  I ordered my burrito, which they made wrong, and when I asked them to make a new one because I asked for NO SOUR CREAM, I cant stand sour cream and they were not willing to do it.  He said I never told him no sour cream.  Jerks!!! Awful service, awful food.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY AT LA PLAYA TAQUERIA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: n c.

description: They aren't particularly friendly, but they don't have to be, since they are one of the only mexican places going in the sunset. the food is good enough to keep me coming back. and the aren't always rude. sign me up for a chicken super burrito or some nachos every other week or so!
author: J D.

description: Nice workers, not the best food food but good enough to eat regularly
author: Ben W.

description: well made burritos, quick and efficient .. not the bomb, but a mortar thrown in ... i'm there for the quick fix until i head into the mission hoodie ...
author: tim y.

description: Overall good food, enjoyed the steak and shrimp burrito & the vegetarian. Didn't know that you had to request hot sauce, it should have been a given. which for a takeout order was very disappointing.
author: jeff P.

description: just moved a few blocks from this joint , been there twice both times did not disappoint. never got stale chips as other reviews mention, may be its cause i went during lunch hours. i recommend the super burrito with carne asada. with black beans, decent amount of the standard ingredients and evenly distributed** it means a lot when the cheese or avocado IS NOT at the ass end of the burrito, kudos to the roller :D
author: Wei W.

description: This place is great and I can't comprehend how it has the same 3 star rating as a KFC-Taco Bell.  Nothing hits the spot after a surf session like a super chicken burrito from La Playa Taqueria.  The chicken is always cooked to perfection unlike most burrito shops that over cook everything.  The staff is always friendly, polite, and attentive.  If you are in the Sunset this is a go to spot for a quick cheap meal.
author: David C.

description: I've been here at least 6 times in 1.5 months of living in outer sunset.  I always get the super carne asada burrito w/ pinto beans and am usually very satisfied with it.  There was one time that I took it to go and and my burrito was upset and no longer hot after sitting upright and in the open on my walk back home.  The service is fairly quick and the price is actually decent.  I noticed someone said it was fairly greasy - don't eat mexican food then!  I also read a note saying they microwave their chips... they actually fry them and store them under a heat lamp.  I agree that the salsa isn't up to par.  I think it has to do with them pre packing it into those little dixies and leaving them out for such a long time.  An alternate place with essentially the same food is "beach burrito" (almost the same name!) on Judah and 44th but they're a bit more expensive.  I enjoy this place and will continue to go my typical once a week.
author: Sokokyu K.

description: Not too many options for Mexican food in the outer Sunset.  Burritos are average, but the quesadillas are pretty good.  Only 2 stars, cuz the service sucks, despite what other reviews say.  If I phone in the order, there's usually little or no wait.  But if I drop in, it takes forever.  And of the 7 or so times I've been there, I've dealt with rude cashiers with an attitude at least 5 times.  And they've gotten my order wrong at least 3 times.  But sometimes my wife and I crave Mexican food, and there's really not a whole lot of choices out here.
author: R N.

description: Since there's this, Taco Bell (yuck), place on judah and the place on taravel not too many good burrito places in the sunset. But this is damn good. We usually eat here once a month, and i always get the steak and shrimp. It's damn good.
author: John H.

description: I have been buying their grilled chicken burrito w/ black beans for years. Recently I notice the tastes of their burrito is going down the hill, price is going up the hill. Today I made a mistake to buy the burrito again. I did not see any chunks of chicken at all, mysterious canned tuna like meat, tasted awful. Looked like food scrap was wrapped. Only a few bites, I couldn't finish it, scared to have food poisoning.  I will not try their food again. BAD, BAD, shame on you La Playa !
author: Hanako S.

description: This place is alright - used to be better when they first opened, but lately, my food always seems like its been sitting around for awhile before they serve it.  Not sure what the deal is, but they're going to lose my business going forward.
author: dontdoit d.
